Method.description: Add storage to a MySQL Cloud Service instance. MySQL Cloud Service supports adding storage to dataStorage, backupStorage, or MySQLLogStorage.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Return the messages of an Oracle MySQL Service Instance operation.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Creates an Oracle Java Cloud Service instance. Optionally, you can:
  • Enable Oracle Traffic Director (OTD) as a local load balancer
  • Add a Coherence data tier cluster

Heap sizes: The heap sizes for the Managed Server processes are determined automatically by the compute shape you specify for the WebLogic component type. See About Heap Size Settings for Oracle Java Cloud Service Instances in Using Oracle Java Cloud Service. When creating a service instance, you can define your own JVM memory configuration if you don't want to use the computed values, and you can customize the Managed Server JVM arguments configuration.

Database software release: Only Oracle Java Cloud Service instances based on WebLogic Server 12.2.1 fully support using the Oracle Database 12.2 version for the database that contains the required Oracle schemas for the service instance.

AppToCloud migration: (Not available on Oracle Cloud Machine) The AppToCloud infrastructure enables you to quickly migrate existing Java applications and their supporting Oracle WebLogic Server resources to Oracle Java Cloud Service. To import an on-premises WebLogic Server domain configuration and its deployed applications into Oracle Java Cloud Service, you must create a service instance with the appropriate AppToCloud artifacts that are uploaded to an Oracle Storage Cloud Service container. Before you can create such a service instance, there are certain prerequisites that must be met, and certain on-premises tasks and Oracle Cloud tasks that must be performed. See About AppToCloud Prerequisites, AppToCloud Considerations and Limitations, and Typical Workflow for Migrating Applications to Oracle Java Cloud Service in Using Oracle Java Cloud Service. After performing the required tasks, to associate the service instance with the AppToCloud artifacts when you create the instance, you must use customPayload in the request body and adhere to these conditions when creating:

  • Must use the PAAS service level
  • Must use either the 12.2.1 or 12.1.3 version (even if your source domain is running a 11g version)
  • Must use either the EE or SUITE edition
  • Cannot currently add a Coherence data tier to a service instance that has AppToCloud
  • Must use an existing Oracle Storage Cloud Service container for the service instance backups. Cannot let the provisioning system create the container for you.

IP networks: (Not available on Oracle Cloud Machine) A service instance can be attached to an IP network that is already created in Oracle Compute Cloud Service. If you specify an IP network, note that each underlying VM is auto-assigned a public and private IP address. See Creating an IP Network in Using Oracle Compute Cloud Service (IaaS).

IP reservations: (Not available on Oracle Cloud Machine) A consequence of using an IP network is that the auto-assigned IP address could change each time the service instance is started. To assign fixed public IP addresses to a service instance that is attached to an IP network, you can first create reserved IP addresses, then provision the service instance to use those persistent IP addresses. See IP Reservations REST Endpoints for information about how to find unused IP reservations and, if needed, create new IP reservations.

Exadata database and IP reservations: (Not available on Oracle Cloud Machine) If you plan to use an Oracle Exadata database with an Oracle Java Cloud Service instance in an account where regions are not supported, see the My Oracle Support document titled How to Request Authorized IPs for Provisioning a Java Cloud Service with Database Exadata Cloud Service (MOS Note 2163568.1) to submit a request for IP reservations. You must obtain IP reservations for the Managed Servers you are going to provision before creating the service instance. The number of IP reservations you need corresponds to the number of Managed Server nodes you want to provision in the cluster.

Deprecation note: The resource path /paas/service/jcs/api/v1.1/instances/{identityDomainId} will be deprecated in the future. See Deprecation Notice for Service Instances.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Returns information about all Oracle Java Cloud Service instances. You can view the full set of details by specifying the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

Deprecation note: The resource path /paas/service/jcs/api/v1.1/instances/{identityDomainId} will be deprecated in the future. See Deprecation Notice for Service Instances.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Returns the status of an Oracle Java Cloud Service instance lifecycle operation.

Deprecation note: This endpoint will be deprecated in the future. See Deprecation Notice for Service Instances.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
Deletes an Oracle Java Cloud Service instance.

If the service instance uses IP reservations on Managed Server nodes (and load balancer nodes, if OTD is configured), those IP reservations are released and returned to the pool of pre-allocated IP reservations with the status of UNUSED. Released IP reservations are not deleted when the service instance is deleted.

Deprecation note: The resource path /paas/service/jcs/api/v1.1/instances/{identityDomainId}/{serviceId} will be deprecated in the future. See Deprecation Notice for Service Instances.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Controls the lifecycle state of a service instance and its virtual machines (VMs). Specifically, you can:
  • Stop or start an Oracle Java Cloud Service instance and all its VMs
  • Restart the Administration Server and its associated VM
  • Stop, start, or restart the load balancer and its associated VM
  • Stop, start, or restart a Managed Server and its associated VM

See About Stopping and Starting an Oracle Java Cloud Service Instance and Individual VMs in Using Oracle Java Cloud Service for complete information about what happens when an instance is stopped and started. For example, all data in the Coherence cache is lost when a service instance that has a Coherence data tier is stopped.

If you have an HOURLY billing frequency, you will not be charged for the time that an Oracle Java Cloud Service instance is in stopped state.

Deprecation note: The resource path /paas/service/jcs/api/v1.1/instances/{identityDomainId}/{serviceId} will be deprecated in the future. See Deprecation Notice for Service Instances.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Returns information about an Oracle Java Cloud Service instance.

Deprecation note: The resource path /paas/service/jcs/api/v1.1/instances/{identityDomainId}/{serviceId} will be deprecated in the future. See Deprecation Notice for Service Instances.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Create an API collection in the organization that's identified by the org path parameter.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Retrieves all API collections in the organization specified by the org path parameter. For each API collection, it lists the metadata for the APIs in the collection, including the links to the canonical OpenAPI (formerly Swagger) descriptions.

You can use the filter query parameter to filter the results.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Creates an API collection or updates an existing one that's identified by the org, apiCollectionName and apiCollectionVersion path parameters.

Method.name: PATCH
Method.description: Updates an existing API collection that is identified by the org, apiCollectionName and apiCollectionVersion path parameters.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Retrieves the metadata for the API collection that's identified by the org, apiCollectionName and apiCollectionVersion path parameters.

The metadata includes the version, title, description, and category, as well as a list of the APIs in the collection. The list contains links to each API's related resources, including its canonical description in OpenAPI (formerly Swagger) format.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Delete the metadata of the API collection that's identified by the org, apiCollectionName and apiCollectionVersion path parameters.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Adds an API to the API collection that's identified by the org, apiCollectionName and apiCollectionVersion path parameters.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Updates the API that's identified by the org, apiCollectionName and apiCollectionVersion, and apiName path parameters.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes the API that's identified by the org, apiCollectionName and apiCollectionVersion, and apiName

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves the metadata for the API that's identified by the apiName path param. The metadata includes the name, title, short description, and links to related resources that includes its canonical description in OpenAPI (formerly Swagger) format.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Updates the user-uploaded API description that's identified by the org, apiCollectionName and apiCollectionVersion, and apiName

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves the API description that exactly matches the description that the user uploaded for the API that's identified by the org, apiCollectionName, apiCollectionVersion, and apiName path parameters.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves the machine-readable OpenAPI (formerly Swagger) description for the API that's identified by the org, apiCollectionName, apiCollectionVersion, and apiName path parameters.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Retrieves API collections in the catalog. For each collection, it lists the metadata for all APIs in the collection, including the links to the canonical OpenAPI (formerly Swagger) descriptions.

You can use the filter query parameter to filter the results.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves the authenticated user's API collections in the catalog.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Deprecated. Retrieves the root category resource.

By default, the response contains a list of the root category's immediate children. To fetch further generations of child categories, use the depth query parameter.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Deprecated. Retrieves the category identified by the path parameter.

A parent category contains a list of its immediate children by default. To fetch further generations of child categories, use the depth query parameter.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Stores or replaces the complete list of categories for the organization that's identified by the org path parameter.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves all the categories for the organization that's identified by the org path parameter.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Creates an organization.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves organizations in the catalog.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Creates an organization or updates an existing one that's identified by the org path parameter.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves the organization specified by the org path parameter.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes an organization.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves the authenticated user's organizations in the catalog.

Method.description: Performs a case-insensitive search across all the API collections and APIs for properties that contain the string that is provided in the q query parameter, and returns a list of the matching API collections and APIs. The list provides links to get more information about each match.

Method.name: POST

Method.description: Create a list of consumers specified by consumer ID with additional attributes, if provided. If a consumer ID already exists, an update is performed on the existing object using the new or revised attribute values.

Method.description: Gets all consumers, including consumer ID, shipping location information, and e-mail information.

Method.name: PUT

Method.description: Creates a list of products specified by product ID with additional attributes, such as name, brand name, and image URL. If a product ID already exists, an update is performed on the existing object using the new or revised attribute values.

Method.description: Gets all the products name, image URL, brand name, categories, and other attributes.

Method.name: PUT

Method.name: GET
Method.description: \nRetrive the version numbers of the API that are supported.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: \nShows top-level resources available in this version.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This method expects one or more address input records to be cleaned. On success, it sends any output records back.

This input should be sent as a JSON array containing at least one record element. The input must be sent as a content, type 'application-json'. Each record element must have all required attributes set and should be formatted as a JSON map.

Example Requests

[{"addressid":"a225-65f8b7f90b18","address1":"500 Oracle Parkway","city":"Redwood City","defaultcountrycode":"US","charcase":"M","mode":"V"}]

The following example shows a client invocation using the command-line tool curl. Copy/paste the line for a quick test.
curl -i -H "Accept: application/json" -H "Content-Type: application/json" --basic --user myname:mypasswd -X POST -d "[{\"addressid\":\"a225-65f8b7f90b18\",\"address1\":\"500 Oracle Parkway\",\"city\":\"Redwood City\",\"defaultcountrycode\" :\"US\",\"charcase\":\"M\",\"mode\":\"V\"}]" https://mydataservice-a18451.data.dc777.oraclecloud.com/av/api/v2/addressclean

Each input record and each output record is a JSON map, and the parameters are described in the following table. Each parameter, input or output, can be included in the JSON map, even if the parameter is not applicable to the mode of this particular record. In this case, the parameter is ignored. For more information, see Address Clean Interface of Enterprise Data Quality 11.1.1.7.9.
Attribute Name Data Type Direction Applicable Modes Notes
addressid String In/Out V,S Identifier to map input records to output records and vice versa.
address1 String In/Out V,S Address line 1.

For SEARCH mode: Oracle recommends that you provide all known information (except country) as text in this field. Only use the country or defaultcountrycode fields when the country is known.
address2 String In/Out V,S Address line 2.
address3 String In/Out V,S Address line 3.
address4 String In/Out V,S Address line 4.
dependentlocality String In/Out V,S A smaller population center data element, dependent on the contents of the city field. For example, a neighborhood in Turkey. For many countries, this attribute is not used.
doubledependentlocality String In/Out V,S The smallest population center data element, dependent on both the contents of the city and dependentlocality fields. For example, a village in the UK. For many countries, this attribute is not used.
city String In/Out V,S The locality, town, or city of the address.
subadminarea String In/Out V,S The smallest geographic data element within a country. For example, a county in the USA.
adminarea String In/Out V,S The most common geographic data element within a country. For example, a state in the USA or a province in Canada.
postalcode String In/Out V,S Postal or zip code for the address, if relevant for the country.
postalcodeprimary String In/Out V,S First part of the postal/zip code.
postalcodesecondary String In/Out V,S Second part of the postal/zip code, if relevant for the country.
country String In/Out V,S On input, an ISO two-character country code (preferred) or country name. On output, the full country name (even if the input is the country ISO code).

Note: If this field is blank, then other fields can be used internally to derive the country. Verify mode requires a country. If both the country field and the defaultcountrycode field are blank, then USA is assigned as the country.

defaultcountrycode String Input only V,S Default ISO two-character country code to use if the country code is blank. This overrides the default country value.
outputscript (parameter) String Input only V,S Certain input and output fiels such as (address1..n, administrative areas, city) can be sent and returned in different scripts. (Not country - or postal-code related fields, these must be in Latn (i.e. English).)
As input, only the native script, and, if different, Latn (i.e. English) can be expected to work well. This parameter (optional) then can be used to request a specific script to be returned via an ISO 15924 Code, such as Latn (i.e. English), Cyrl, Grek, Hebr, Hani, Hans, Arab, Thai, Hang, Native>. Native is not a code but rather a suggestion to pick whatever the local script for a given country is. A request to use "Native" and "Latn" can always be fulfilled. If this parameter is not provided or has an empty value, we will turn the option to transliterate off, this is the default behavior. This means, the output script will be selected based on the input script used (i.e. If the input is provided in a native script, and we support this native script, then the output will be in the same native script. In all other cases, the output script will be set to Latn (English))
charcase (parameter) String Input only V,S Transforms output according to the setting:

U (Upper) - Transforms all text to upper case.

L (Lower) - Transforms all text to lower case.

M (Mixed) - Transforms all text to mixed case, except postalcode and adminarea. These field values are left as returned from the AV processor if the address was verified. If the address was not verified, then the postalcode is left as entered, and the adminarea is converted to mixed case.

O (Original) - Text is not transformed.

mode (parameter) String Input only V,S Mode in which the request is to be run.

Enter V to verify this record or S to search for this record. Note that in search mode you can get back up to 20 output records for each input record. These records will be in sorted order, from the best potential search result to the worst.
minimumverificationmatchscore (parameter) Number Input only V,S A numeric value between 0 and 100, representing the minimum score that a match must achieve to be used as a cleaned address. Input addresses are left unchanged if the Match Score of the Address Verification processor for the address is lower than the input value. Optional, default is 0
minimumverificationlevel (parameter) Number Input only V,S A numeric value between 1 and 5, representing the minimum verification level that a match must achieve to be used as a cleaned address. Optional, default is 1.

Input addresses are left unchanged if the Verification Level of the Address Verification processor for the address is lower than the input value. For a description of each level, see Section 2.1.3, "Notes on Verification Levels".

allowedverificationresultcodes (parameter) String Input only S A list of any of the following single-letter result codes with no separator. Optional, the default string for Verify Mode is 'VP' and for Search Mode 'VPAR'.

V (Verified)

P (Partially Verified)

A (Ambiguous)

R (Reverted)

U (Unverified, can not be requested as input)

Input addresses are left unchanged if the Verification Result Code (for example, the first character of the verificationcode) for the address is not one of the listed input values.

fulladdress String Output only V,S Full verified address returned from address verification. The address lines are pipe-separated.
countrycode String Output only V,S ISO 2 char country code of verified address country.
verificationcode String Output only V,S Verification code for the address. For detailed information, see the verificationcodedescription field the AccuracyCode tab AccuracyCode on the Address Verification Processor page.
verified String Output only V,S In Verify mode: Whether the result produced was verified to a sufficient level according to the configuration of the process and the resultant verification code. This also indicates whether or not the input address was changed to the returned address from address verification.

In Search mode: Could find at least one or more results for this input. Return values: Y Yes successful, N No not successful, or X EDQ AV misconfigured.
verificationcodedescription String Output only V,S English description of the verification code.

The country provided (implicitly or explicitly), has a special status in verification mode. And in verification mode, it is possible to get results back that contain the overall status UNVERIFIED / verified=N but contain a match score of 100. In this case, the UNVERIFIED status is given priority over the score.

latitude Number Output only V WGS 84 latitude in decimal degrees format.
longitude Number Output only V WGS 84 longitude in decimal degrees format.
geoaccuracycode String Output only V A code indicating the level of accuracy of the returned geocode (latitude and longitude) coordinates. See the online help for the EDQ Address Verification processor for more information on the returned code.
geoaccuracycodedescription String Output only V English description of the geoaccuracycode.
geodistance Number Output only V Radius of accuracy (in meters) for the returned geocodes. The higher the value, the less accurate the geocoding result.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Provides a list of all top level resources available in this version.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Provides a list of address-related rest endpoints.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Address Capture This endpoint provides the second phase of Loqate's Auto-Complete solution. (Look at the /address/complete section for the first phase.) This solution performs a single line word based search across multiple address components of the worldwide address data set. It is the recommended solution for real time address validation on any data entry form.

The input of this POST request is a JSON object containing a mandatory result field, a mandatory query field, a mandatory country field and an optional filters map.
The result is the zero based index of the desired result. This is the only field new to Phase 2, all the other fields should be left as used in Phase 1. The query field should represent what the user is currently typing and looking for.
The country field is the name / ISO String of the country.
The filters field is a JSON map of fields; all field values are represented as Strings. Filter fields, when valid for the country in question, limits the search. For example, if the country was set to "USA", then setting only "Locality":"San Francisco" in the filters would limit the query to cities called San Francisco across all the States in the USA.

The output is a JSON object containing a Status field and an output map.
The output map contains the fields of the verified and complete address. All field values are Strings.
The output contains a Status field, where the value "OK" means that the overall transaction could be completed. If Status shows "Error", then the field "Error" shows the reason.

Except some minor differences, such as no need to transmit a parameter lqtkey, this endpoint is very similar to www.everythingLocation.com Address Capture

Cost: The user is charged for this endpoint for each successfully captured address.

Functionality: This endpoint, Phase 2, is meant to be used whenever the user has narrowed down his search in Phase 1 enough and wants to have the full address. Except for the result field, all the other fields should be left as they were at the end of Phase 1. A sample is shown in Request 3 below. The full address then with all available fields is then returned. For more detailed information on the meaning of each field of this address record, please refer to the table in the /address/verify section.

Request 3 { "result":"0", "query":"941", "country":"us", "filters": { "Premise": "941", "Thoroughfare": "Page St", "PostalCode": "94117", "Locality": "San Francisco", "AdministrativeArea": "CA" } }

Response 3 { "Status": "OK", "output": { "Address": "941 Page St, San Francisco CA 94117-2349", "Address1": "941 Page St", "Address2": "San Francisco CA 94117-2349", "AdministrativeArea": "CA", "CountryName": "United States", "DeliveryAddress": "941 Page St", "DeliveryAddress1": "941 Page St", "ISO3166-2": "US", "ISO3166-3": "USA", "ISO3166-N": "840", "Locality": "San Francisco", "MatchedFieldList": "PostalCodePrimary,AdministrativeArea,Locality,Thoroughfare,PremiseNumber", "PostalCode": "94117-2349", "PostalCodePrimary": "94117", "PostalCodeSecondary": "2349", "Premise": "941", "PremiseNumber": "941", "SearchMethod": "AutoComplete", "SubAdministrativeArea": "San Francisco", "Thoroughfare": "Page St", "TotalRecordCount": "1" }, "Error": null }

Method.name: POST
Method.description: WARNING this description can not be encoded by Python!!!

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Address Complete This endpoint provides the first phase of Loqate's Auto-Complete solution. (Look at the /address/capture section for the second phase.) This solution performs a single line word based search across multiple address components of the worldwide address data set. It is the recommended solution for real time address validation on any data entry form.

Countries currently supported by Auto-Complete: Australia, Canada, UK, USA. More are in the works. If unsupported countries are passed in, the old-style search is invoked.

The input of this POST request is a JSON object containing a mandatory query field, a mandatory country field and an optional filters field.
The query field should represent what the user is currently typing and looking for.
The country field is the name / ISO String of the country.
The filters field is a JSON map of fields; all field values are represented as Strings. Filter fields, when valid for the country in question, limits the search. For example, if the country was set to "USA", then setting only "Locality":"San Francisco" in the filters would limit the query to cities called San Francisco across all the States in the USA.

The output is a JSON object containing a Status field, a list of output address records called outputs[] and another list called metadata[]. These two lists always have the same length, and metadata at index n corresponds to outputs at index n.
The output contains a Status field, where the value "OK" means that the overall transaction could be completed. If Status shows "Error", then the field "Error" shows the reason.

Except some minor differences, such as no need to transmit a parameter lqtkey, this endpoint is very similar to www.everythingLocation.com Address Complete

Cost: The user is not charged for this endpoint. Only in the next phase is charging applicable.

Functionality: This endpoint, Phase 1, is meant to be used multiple times, to allow the user find the desired search result. This process works as follows: The user starts with an initial query string, Request 1 below, with some filters and only a house number entered. Loqate returns results where this number is found anywhere (i.e. in the Zip code, house number, etc), as shown in Response 1, and the UI should present these to these results (outputs) in some shape or form to the user.
Now, let's say the user is interested in the output string "941 Page St|San Francisco CA 94117". From the corresponding metadata, one can see these output-only fields:
"MatchedFieldList": "AdministrativeArea,Locality,PremiseNumber"; this indicates where fields could be matched.
"TotalRecordCount": "3"; number of total available records to match.
That means, there are still three potential matches for this output string. To get to this result, the user has several options to proceed, depending on the UI:
The user could continue typing (i.e. adding to the query input) until the complete address has been typed.
Or the user could do a Type-Click Drill Down. In this case, the user selects the desired output string (typical by clicking on it). In the latter case, the UI should look at fields in the metadata for this particular output string, and use them as filters to issue another complete request, which is shown in Request 2. (Note: The table from the /address/verify section shows which fields are both Input and Output fields.). The corresponding response is shown in Response 2.
This process of repeated complete requests maybe be repeated until certainty is reached that one output string is the desired result. Then it's time to proceed to Phase 2, which is described in the /address/capture section.

Request 1 { "query":"941", "country":"us", "filters": { "Locality": "San Francisco", "AdministrativeArea": "CA" } }

Response 1 { "Status": "OK", "outputs": [ "San Francisco CA 94102", "941 Dolores St|San Francisco CA 94110", "941a Guerrero St|San Francisco CA 94110", "941a Shotwell St|San Francisco CA 94110", "941b Shotwell St|San Francisco CA 94110", "941c Shotwell St|San Francisco CA 94110", "941d Shotwell St|San Francisco CA 94110", "941e Shotwell St|San Francisco CA 94110", "941 Page St|San Francisco CA 94117" ], "metadata": [ { "TotalRecordCount": "5145", "MatchedFieldList": "PostalCodePrimary,AdministrativeArea,Locality", "Locality": "San Francisco", "AdministrativeArea": "CA", "PostalCode": "94102", "CountryName": "United States" }, { "TotalRecordCount": "4", "MatchedFieldList": "AdministrativeArea,Locality,PremiseNumber", "Premise": "941", "Thoroughfare": "Dolores St", "Locality": "San Francisco", "AdministrativeArea": "CA", "PostalCode": "94110", "CountryName": "United States" }, { "TotalRecordCount": "1" }, { "TotalRecordCount": "1" }, { "TotalRecordCount": "1" }, { "TotalRecordCount": "1" }, { "TotalRecordCount": "1" }, { "TotalRecordCount": "1" }, { "TotalRecordCount": "3", "MatchedFieldList": "AdministrativeArea,Locality,PremiseNumber", "Premise": "941", "Thoroughfare": "Page St", "Locality": "San Francisco", "AdministrativeArea": "CA", "PostalCode": "94117", "CountryName": "United States" } ], "Error": null }

Request 2 { "query":"941", "country":"us", "filters": { "Premise": "941", "Thoroughfare": "Page St", "PostalCode": "94117", "Locality": "San Francisco", "AdministrativeArea": "CA" } }

Response 2 { "Status": "OK", "outputs": [ "941 Page St|San Francisco CA 94117-2349" ], "metadata": [ { "TotalRecordCount": "1" } ], "Error": null }

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes data cached for all tables on all databases

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes data cached for all tables on a database

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes data cached for a table

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Pings the database server where your data for Oracle BI Cloud Service is stored to see if it is available.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about the database objects in the default schema for Oracle BI Cloud Service and the space consumed by them.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns the timestamp of the database server where your data for Oracle BI Cloud Service is stored. The timestamp is returned as a number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns the timestamp of the web server where Oracle BI Cloud Service is running. The timestamp is returned as a number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Returns version and usage information for the REST API.

Note: Follow the suggested BatchSize guideline when you upload data using Manage Table Data APIs. The upload time increases with larger batch sizes and this can significantly affect the failure points. Smaller batch sizes generally upload faster.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Lists the names of data sets in the schema. You can list all the data sets that belong to a user or use a query filter to list data sets that match a name pattern.

Use an asterisk (*) as a wildcard in your query filter.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
Creates a data set.

Note: The body parameter is multipart/mixed with two parts. The first part contains load information in the JSON structure shown below. The second part is the data in application/octet-stream format, which is not shown due to a Swagger limitation. Data in the stream can be any custom delimiter separated text data (for example, a CSV file) or in the form of Java object arrays (one per record) which support a wider range of data types.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Creates a new data set or updates an existing data set.

Note: The body parameter is multipart/mixed with two parts. The first part contains load information in the JSON structure shown below. The second part is the data in application/octet-stream format, which is not shown due to a Swagger limitation. Data in the stream can be any custom delimiter separated text data (for example, a CSV file) or in the form of Java object arrays (one per record) which support a wider range of data types.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes a named data set.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about a named data set.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
Inserts data into a named table. You can insert all the records from the data stream or only those records that do not exist in the table.

The PUT method supports content that is compressed with gzip. To use compression, encode the data in this format and add this header to the request: "Content-Encoding: gzip".

Note: The body parameter is multipart/mixed with two parts. The first part contains load information in the JSON structure shown below. The second part is the data in application/octet-stream format, which is not shown due to a Swagger limitation. Data in the stream can be any custom delimiter separated text data (for example, a CSV file) or in the form of Java object arrays (one per record) which support a wider range of data types

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Updates data in a named table. You can only update records that exist in the table or update existing records and add new records that do not exist yet.

The POST method supports content that is compressed with gzip. To use compression encode the datain this format and add the following header to the request: "Content-Encoding: gzip".

Note: The body parameter is multipart/mixed with two parts. The first part contains load information in the JSON structure shown below. The second part is the data in application/octet-stream format, which is not shown due to a Swagger limitation. Data in the stream can be any custom delimiter separated text data (for example, a CSV file) or in the form of Java object arrays (one per record) which support a wider range of data types.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description:
Deletes data from a named table. If no arguments are specified, then the table is truncated.

If you want to filter delete operations on the table, you can use parameters to specify a JSON filter object.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Lists the names of tables in the schema. You can list all the tables in a schema or use a query filter to list tables that match a name pattern.

Use an asterisk (*) as a wildcard in your query filter.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
Creates a table from a JSON definition listing all the columns and the attributes for each column.

If the table already exists, an error displays.

Note: You can use the POST method to modify an existing table.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Modifies an existing table. For example, you can add columns or to modify their attributes. If the table does not exist, this method creates the table from a JSON definition listing all the columns and the attributes for each column.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes (drops) a named table.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about a named table. Specify the name of a table in the schema to return a table definition for that table.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about all the indexes associated with a named table.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Creates an index from a JSON definition listing all the columns and the attributes for each column.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes (drops) a named index, if it exists.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about an index.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Gathers statistics for a named table.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about the data in a table, such as the number of rows and columns, and when the table was last analyzed.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieve the name of a specific policy

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Run a specific policy

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieve the name of a specific policy

Method.name: GET
POST
GET
PUT
PATCH
Method.description:
Update the application state by applying one of the supported actions: - Submit : Submits an application for review. This moves the application to a PENDING_REVIEW state for an Administrator to review. - Publish: Publishes an application to the Marketplace. This makes the application available on the public Marketplace. The application status is changed to "PUBLISHED". Only an approved application can be published. - Withdraw : Withdraws an application from the Marketplace. This can be called only on a published application. - MakePrivate: Makes a published application private. A private application will not display for browsing or searching on the public Marketplace. A private URL to this application can be shared with customers to give them access to the private listing.

1. Submit an Application

The following example submits a partner's unpublished application for Oracle approval, by submitting a PATCH request on the REST resource using cURL. A submission note can be provided when the submit action is chosen.

cURL Example

curl -X PATCH -H "X-Oracle-UserId: partner-email" -H "Authorization: Bearer Access-token" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d 'JSON-data-as-shown-in-following-example' "https://ocm-apis.cloud.oracle.com/appstore/publisher/v1/applications/2908689"

Request Header

X-Oracle-UserId: fname.lname@oracle.com 
Authorization: Bearer Access-token 
Content-Type: application/json

Request Body

{
  "action": "submit",
  "note": "any submission notes for admin"
}

HTTP Status Code:

200 OK

JSON Response:

{
  "message": "submit operation successful on listing.",
  "entityId": "8422545"
}

2. Publish an Application

The following example publishes an application by a partner after it has been approved by Oracle admin, by submitting a PATCH request on the REST resource using cURL.

cURL Example

curl -X PATCH -H "X-Oracle-UserId: partner-email" -H "Authorization: Bearer Access-token" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d 'JSON-data-as-shown-in-following-example' "https://ocm-apis.cloud.oracle.com/appstore/publisher/v1/applications/2908689"

Request Header

X-Oracle-UserId: fname.lname@oracle.com 
Authorization: Bearer Access-token 
Content-Type: application/json

Request Body

{
  "action": "publish",
  "note": "any submission notes for admin"
}

HTTP Status Code:

200 OK

JSON Response:

{
  "message": "publish operation successful on listing. Earlier version, if any, would be withdrawn.",
  "entityId": "8422545"
}

3. Withdraw an Application

The following example withdraws an application published by a partner from the marketplace, by submitting a PATCH request on the REST resource using cURL.

cURL Example

curl -X PATCH -H "X-Oracle-UserId: partner-email" -H "Authorization: Bearer Access-token" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d "JSON-data-as-shown-in-following-example" "https://ocm-apis.cloud.oracle.com/appstore/publisher/v1/applications/2908689"

Request Header

X-Oracle-UserId: fname.lname@oracle.com 
Authorization: Bearer Access-token 
Content-Type: application/json

Request Body

{
  "action": "withdraw"
}

HTTP Status Code:

200 OK

JSON Response:

{
  "message": "withdraw operation successful on listing.",
  "entityId": "2908689"
}

4. Make an Application Private

The following example makes a listing by a partner private, by submitting a PATCH request on the REST resource using cURL.

cURL Example

curl -X PATCH -H "X-Oracle-UserId: partner-email" -H "Authorization: Bearer Access-token" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d "JSON-data-as-shown-in-following-example" "https://ocm-apis.cloud.oracle.com/appstore/publisher/v1/applications/2908689"

Request Header

X-Oracle-UserId: fname.lname@oracle.com 
Authorization: Bearer Access-token 
Content-Type: application/json

Request Body

{
  "action": "makePrivate"
}

HTTP Status Code:

200 OK

JSON Response:

{
    "message": "makePrivate operation successful on listing.",
    "entityId": "8422545"
}

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description:
Delete an application. Only applications that are in a NEW state can be deleted.

The following example deletes an existing application by a partner, by submitting a DELETE request on the REST resource using cURL.

cURL Example

curl -X DELETE -H "X-Oracle-UserId: partner-email" -H "Authorization: Bearer Access-token" "https://ocm-apis.cloud.oracle.com/appstore/publisher/v1/applications/2908689"

Request Header

X-Oracle-UserId: fname.lname@oracle.com 
Authorization: Bearer Access-token

Request Body

   None

HTTP Status Code:

200 OK

JSON Response:

{
  "message": "APPLICATION was deleted.",
  "entityId": "8422402",
}

POST

Method.description:
Update screenshot for an application.

The following example updates a screenshot for an existing application belonging to a partner, by submitting a PUT request on the REST resource using cURL.

curl -X PUT -H "X-Oracle-UserId: partner-email" -H "Authorization: Bearer Access-token" -H "Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=----WebKitFormBoundary7MA4YWxkTrZu0gW " -F "file=@file-path" -F "json=JSON-data-as-shown-in-following-example" "https://ocm-apis.cloud.oracle.com/appstore/publisher/v1/applications/2908689/screenshots/2916362"

X-Oracle-UserId: fname.lname@oracle.com 
Authorization: Bearer Access-token

Request Body

[form-data]

file: File Upload (screen_shots_1.png)

   "name": "screen_shots_2", 
   "description": "screen_shots_2 update",
   "fileName": "screen_shots_1.png",
   "sourceType": "INTERNAL"
}

HTTP Status Code:

200 OK

{
  "entityId": "8434954",
  "name": "screen_shots_2"
}

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Create a new version for an already published application listing. A new version is necessary to make edits to an already published listing.The new version has to go though the same life cycle and approval workflow to get published to the Marketplace. Publishing the new version automatically archives the older version from the Marketplace. At any given point only one version of the application is active on the Marketplace.

The following example creates a new version for an existing application by a partner, by submitting a POST request on the REST resource using cURL. It returns the newly created version ID.

cURL Example

curl -X POST -H "X-Oracle-UserId: partner-email" -H "Authorization: Bearer Access-token" "https://ocm-apis.cloud.oracle.com/appstore/publisher/v1/applications/2908689/version"

Request Header

X-Oracle-UserId: fname.lname@oracle.com 
Authorization: Bearer Access-token

Request Body

None

HTTP Status Code:

201 Created

JSON Response:

{
  "message": "A new version was created.",
  "entityId": "8432130",
}

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description:
Delete a related document for an existing application.

The following example deletes a related document for an existing application belonging to a partner, by submitting a DELETE request on the REST resource using cURL.

Request Body

   None

HTTP Status Code:

200 OK

  "entityId": "8422545",
}

Upload an icon for the application listing. The icon dimensions must be 130 X 130 px. The following extensions are allowed: png, jpg.

curl -X POST -H "X-Oracle-UserId: partner-email" -H "Authorization: Bearer Access-token" -H "Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=----WebKitFormBoundary7MA4YWxkTrZu0gW " -F "image=@file-path" "https://ocm-apis.cloud.oracle.com/appstore/publisher/v1/applications/2908689/icon"

X-Oracle-UserId: fname.lname@oracle.com 
Authorization: Bearer Access-token

[form-data]

Image: File Upload

201 Created

JSON Response:

{
  "message": "Icon upload was successful.",
  "entityId": "2915754",
}

Method.name: GET
POST
Method.description:
Multi part Upload - Image file gets uploaded in one step.

1.Upload Whole Machine Image

The following example uploads the machineimage, by submitting a POST request on the REST resource using cURL.

cURL Example

curl -X POST -H "X-Oracle-UserId: partner-email" -H "Authorization: Bearer Access-token" -H "X-File-Name: FileName to be uploaded" -F "json=JSON-data-as-shown-in-following-example" "https://ocm-apis.cloud.oracle.com/appstore/publisher/v1/machineimages"

Request Header

X-Oracle-UserId: fname.lname@oracle.com 
Authorization: Bearer Access-token 
X-File-Name: machineImage.tar.gz

Request Body

[form-data]

file: File Upload (machineImage.tar.gz)
json: {"application": "My_Machine_Image","version":"1.0","operatingSystem":"linux"}

HTTP Status Code:

200 OK

JSON Response:

{
  "message": "OK",
  "entityId": "7934470"
}

2.Initiate Machine Image in chunks upload

The following example initiates the machineimage chunks upload and uploads the first chunk, by submitting a POST request on the REST resource using cURL.

cURL Example

curl -X POST -H "X-Oracle-UserId: partner-email" -H "Authorization: Bearer Access-token" -H "X-File-Name: FileName to be uploaded" -H "X-Number-Of-Chunks: Total number of Chunks" -F "json=JSON-data-as-shown-in-following-example" -F "uploadType as shown in the following example" "https://ocm-apis.cloud.oracle.com/appstore/publisher/v1/machineimages"

Request Header

X-Oracle-UserId: fname.lname@oracle.com 
Authorization: Bearer Access-token 
X-File-Name: machineImage.tar.gz
X-Number-Of-Chunks: 3

Request Body

[form-data]

json: {"application": "My_Machine_Image_chunk","version":"1.0","operatingSystem":"linux"}
uploadType : {Chunk}

HTTP Status Code:

200 OK

JSON Response:

{
  "message": "OK",
  "entityId": "7934472"
}

HEAD

[form-data]
action: upload

200 OK

{
  "message": "OK",
  "entityId": "7934756"
}

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Upload part of a file in a chunk and specify the chunk number.

The following example uploads the machineimage chunk, by submitting a POST request on the REST resource using cURL.

cURL Example

curl -X POST -H "X-Oracle-UserId: partner-email" -H "Authorization: Bearer Access-token" -H "X-File-Name: FileName to be uploaded"  -H "X-Chunk-Number: Chunk number" "https://ocm-apis.cloud.oracle.com/appstore/publisher/v1/machineimages/7934880/chunk"

Request Header

X-Oracle-UserId: fname.lname@oracle.com 
Authorization: Bearer Access-token 
X-Chunk-Number:1

Request Body

[form-data]

file: File Upload

HTTP Status Code:

200 OK

JSON Response:

{
  "uploadRequestId": "8089067",
  "checksum": "4ccef7d656c4520e57a2af2974e012f0",
  "uploadedChunks": 2,
  "pendingChunks": 0
}

Upload chunk with MD5 Checksum

The following example uploads the machineimage chunk with checksum header, by submitting a POST request on the REST resource using CURL.

cURL Example

curl -X POST -H "X-Oracle-UserId: partner-email" -H "Authorization: Bearer Access-token" -H "X-File-Name: FileName to be uploaded"  -H "X-Chunk-Number: Chunk number" -H "X-MD5-Checksum : MD5 checksum of the file to be uploaded" "https://ocm-apis.cloud.oracle.com/appstore/publisher/v1/machineimages/7934880/chunk"

Request Header

X-Oracle-UserId: fname.lname@oracle.com
Authorization: Bearer Access-token
X-Chunk-Number:1
X-MD5-Checksum :4ccef7d656c4520e57a2af2974e012f0

Request Body

[form-data]

file: File Upload

HTTP Status Code:

200 OK

JSON Response:

{
  "uploadRequestId": "8134858",
  "checksum": "4ccef7d656c4520e57a2af2974e012f0",
  "uploadedChunks": 1,
  "pendingChunks": 1
}

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Import a new cloud stack template file or update an existing template with a new file.

The values of the templateName and templateVersion attributes in the template file are used to uniquely identify a template in Oracle Cloud Stack Manager. To update an existing template, edit the template file and modify the templateVersion attribute.

When you import a template with the same name as an existing template in this account, you create a new version of the template. Any existing stacks that were created from previous versions of this template are not affected.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Move Collection. Move a child collection from one parent to another parent.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Create Collection. Create a collection based on request paramenters. Requires the x-ccasset-language header so translated content can be set for a specific language.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
List Collections. Get a list of collections.

Use the name query param to list the collections whose display name CONTAINS IGNORECASE the given search string. Use the categoryIds param to get a list of collections whose ids match those listed in the comma delimted string value. Either categoryIds or name must be provided.

Optionally takes the x-ccasset-language header to get translated content in another language.

To get the list of included/excluded collections, use a group of {promotionId, itemTypeList and templateValue} parameters together.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
Update Collection. Update a collection by ID. Requires the x-ccasset-language header so translated content can be set for a specific language.

Update childProducts property:
Set the type property to either appendProducts or updateProducts to update the child products of a collection.
EXAMPLE INPUT:
Remove prod1, prod2 and prod3
{'op': 'remove', 'products': ['prod1', 'prod2', 'prod3]}

Move the group of products at indices 5-10 (inclusive) to appear starting at index 2
(shorthand for 'move product 5 to index 2, product 6 to index 3, etc.')
{'op': 'move', 'fromStart': 5, 'fromEnd': 10, 'to' : 2}

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Get Collection. Get a collection by ID. Optionally takes the x-ccasset-language header to get translated content in another language.

Method.description: Delete Collection. Delete a collection by ID.

To get the list of included/excluded Products in a promotion, use a group of {promotionId, itemTypeList and templateValue} parameters together.

Method.description: List Promotion Templates. Get a list of promotions promotion templates. The list of results will be paginated based on query parameters.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
List Promotions. Get a list of promotions including support for pagination and sorting.

The following query params cannot be used together: name and promotionId.

Method.name: PUT

Method.description: Get Promotion. Get a promotion by id. Optionally takes the x-ccasset-language header to get translated content in another language.

Method.description: Get Publish Schedule. Get a list of scheduled publishes.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Get Publish Changes. Get a list of publishing change items. Optionally takes the x-ccasset-language header to get translated content in another language.

Method.description: Update Reason. Update the given reason type with given reason id

Method.description: Create Reason. Create the reason of given type with the given data.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Export Report Data. Export report data as a csv file. There is no json response for this request. The browser will download the csv file directly from the server. Optionally takes the x-ccasset-language header to get translated content in another language.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Get Report Data. Returns the report data as a list of records from a given reportId and other report filtering criteria details . Records are represented as a map with property name and value. Optionally takes the x-ccasset-language header to get translated content in another language.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Set Search Schedule. Schedule a recurring baseline index using an atg.service.scheduler.CalendarSchedule. This method allows setting the schedule from a parseString, and from component parts (hours, minutes, etc). The parseString property will override component part properties, if present.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Get Search Schedule. Return a representation of the recurring baseline index schedule, if any. The returned properties correspond to values from the backing atg.service.scheduler.CalendarSchedule instance.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Request Index. Request a baseline or partial index. May be started immediately (if no index is in progress), or queued.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Get Search Indexing Status. Get the search indexing status. Includes information about the current indexing job, queued indexing job, and search history.

Method.description: Create Shipping Method. Create a new shipping method based on request parameters. Requires the x-ccasset-language header so translated content can be set for a specific language.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Create Comment. Creates an order comment in the repository by passing the orderId in the input.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Get Comments. Gets order comments from the repository by passing orderId and type(set as 'order').

Method.name: GET
Method.description: List Collections. Get a list of collections. Use the name query param to list the collections whose display name CONTAINS IGNORECASE the given search string. Use the categoryIds param to get a list of collections whose ids match those listed in the comma delimted string value. Either categoryIds or name must be provided. Optionally takes the x-ccasset-language header to get translated content in another language.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Get Collection. Get a collection by ID. Unlike the Admin/Store endpoints, this can generate category's dimension id and expand child categories

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Reset Password. Service Endpoint for resetting the user profile password by the Agent

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Create Profile. Creates new user and generates password , if user does not exists for a given email id. Dynamic Properties of profile can be added to the request using the key value pair structure ("dynamicPropertyKey":"dynamicPropertyValue"). These property values can take the type from any of boolean, date, float, string, timestamp, enumerated, big string.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Search Profiles. Get profiles by the search criteria entered. The search criteria include First Name, Last Name, Email, Postal Code, Phone Number .

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Update Profile. Updates customer name, email address, phone number, shipping address and email marketing flag status of the profile depending on the profile ID. Dynamic Properties of profile can also be updated like any other attribute ("dynamicPropertyKey":"dynamicPropertyValue").

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Get Profile. Get details of a customer profile

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Create Exchange Request. Gets list of items from an order for which exchange request can be created with operation set as 'initiateExchange'.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: List Shipping Countries. List all the shipping countries and their regions that have been configured in Admin settings (associated with some Shipping method).

Method.name: GET
Method.description: List Cancel Reasons. Lists the Cancel Reasons for cancelling an order

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Get Disposition Reasons. Lists the Disposition Reasons that can be given while receiving items against a exchange request

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Get Price Override Reasons. Lists the price override reasons while we creating an order.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Get Order States. Lists the order States that can be used for searching for orders

Method.description: List Selected Billing Countries. Lists the billing countries and their regions that are currently configured in Admin settings.

Method.description: Get Return Reasons. Lists the Disposition Reasons that can be given while receiving items against a return request

Method.description: Get Return States. Lists the Order States when Return action will be allowed against orders

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Handle Order Amendment. Performs the operation named initiateAmendment(initiates the order amendment process) by passing op as 'initiateAmendment'.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Submit Order Amendment. Applies the changes made during amend process to the order.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Remove Order Amendment. Discards the order amendment process by removing the clone order.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Create Order. Creates a new order for a customer with operation set as 'createOrder'.Dynamic Properties of order can be added in the the request using the key value pair structure ("dynamicPropertyKey":"dynamicPropertyValue"). These property values can take the types of boolean, date, float, string, timestamp, enumerated, big string. Storefront also has an endopint with same id ('createOrder'), but the behaviour is different. For more informaiton refer Storefront API.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Search Orders. Lists the orders corresponding to the given profileId.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Remove Incomplete Order For Profile. Removes the incomplete order for the profileId specified as query parameter

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Handle Order Actions. Cancels the Order by passing operation as 'cancel'

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Get Order. Loads an order details from the repository. Maps all required fields for order details.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Get All Prices. Return the the list and sale price for the product or SKU. This Endpoint is clone of StoreFront endpoint and it can be used if application running on agent/admin server need access the product prices data configured for StoreFront.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: List Product Variants. Returns a list of variants available for a given Product. A similar endpoint exists for Storefront, that is not implemented currently.

Method.name: GET

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Search. Perform a search given an endeca based query. The response is a formatted endeca JSON that provides all the data based on the type of search. This Endpoint is clone of StoreFront endpoint and it can be used if application running on agent/admin server need access to endeca based search configured for StoreFront.

List Skus. Gets a list of SKUs and its properties. Optionally, search for SKUs in the given catalog by performing a case-insensitive, partial-match on the display name or ID. Optionally, takes the x-ccasset-language header to get translated content in another language.

To get the list of SKUs by SKU ids, use skuIds parameter.

Method.name: GET

Optionally takes the x-ccasset-language header to get translated content in another language. It can also be used to return the list on a searched string and in a sorted order against various properties of profile.

Method.description:
List Collections. Get a list of collections.

Use the name query param to list the collections whose display name CONTAINS IGNORECASE the given search string. Use the categoryIds param to get a list of collections whose ids match those listed in the comma delimted string value. Either categoryIds or name must be provided.

Optionally takes the x-ccasset-language header to get translated content in another language.

To get the list of included/excluded collections, use a group of {promotionId, itemTypeList and templateValue} parameters together.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
Update Collection. Update a collection by ID. Requires the x-ccasset-language header so translated content can be set for a specific language.

Update childProducts property:
Set the type property to either appendProducts or updateProducts to update the child products of a collection.
EXAMPLE INPUT:
Remove prod1, prod2 and prod3
{'op': 'remove', 'products': ['prod1', 'prod2', 'prod3]}

Move the group of products at indices 5-10 (inclusive) to appear starting at index 2
(shorthand for 'move product 5 to index 2, product 6 to index 3, etc.')
{'op': 'move', 'fromStart': 5, 'fromEnd': 10, 'to' : 2}

Method.description: List Filters. Gets all the filters defined by the merchant.

Method.description: Update Filter. Updates the filter object, that can be used to filter the endpoint response. Though both include and exclude are not mandatory, atleast one of them should be populated with data.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Delete Filter. Deletes the filter, corresponding to the passed filterKey.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Get Filter. Gets the filter object for the requested filterKey.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Create Site From Form. Create a site based on the specified properties. Any unspecified properties will be inherited from the default site, except for id, productionURL, and additionalProductionURLs. Note that only a subset of properties can vary by site. Requires the x-ccasset-language header so translated content can be set for a specific language.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: List Addresses. This operation is used to get the list of addresses of an organization.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Create Audience. This operation is used to create a new Audience in Oracle Commerce Cloud.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: List Audiences. This operation is used to get the collection of audiences from Oracle Commerce Cloud.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Update Audience. This operation is used to update an audience in Oracle Commerce Cloud.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Delete Audience. This operation is used to delete an audience from Oracle Commerce Cloud.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Get Audience. This operation is used to get an audience from Oracle Commerce Cloud.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Get Elements. Returns on all global or non-global Elements on the system.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Set Browser Type. Update the settings for a browser type. Fails if the browser type does not exist. The {createIfMissing} query parameter gives an option to create a new entry in database.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Delete Browser Type. Delete a browser type. Fails if the browser type does not exist.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Get Browser Type. Get information on a browser type. If a database search yelds no result, a component configuration lookup will be performed. This can be turned off by setting {databaseOnly} query paremeter to true.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Update Saml Id PSettings. Update the IdP settings.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Get Saml Id PSettings. Get an IdP settings document

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Import the application configuration using the zip content passed in the request body

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes entire configuration of the given application.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Updates search index configuration of the specified application.

Method.name: PATCH
Method.description: Partial updates search index configuration of the specified application.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Creates search index configuration of the application.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes search index configuration of the specified application. \n\n CAUTION: Deleting the search index configuration from your application causes your site to stop working. If you need to replace the current configuration, use a PUT command.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns the search index configuration of the application.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Updates one or more index attributes in the specified application.

Method.name: PATCH
Method.description: Partial updates one or more index attributes in the specified application.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Creates one or more index attributes in the specified application.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes all index attributes from the specified application. This also deletes all owner attributes.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns the index attributes for the specified application. Returns metadata about the attributes (e.g. who created it and when) along with a list of owner attributes. \n\n If zip extension is specified (add ".zip" at the end of the path), the attributes are exported as a zip file.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Updates the specified owner index attributes in the given application's index attributes list.

Method.name: PATCH
Method.description: Partial updates the specified owner index attributes in the given application's index attributes list.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Creates a new config owner's index attributes in the given application's index attributes list.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes an existing config owner index attributes list from the given application.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns the specified owner index attributes. \n\n If zip extension is specified (add ".zip" at the end of the path), the owner attributes are exported as a zip file.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Updates the specific index attribute in the given config owner attributes list.

Method.name: PATCH
Method.description: Partial updates the specific index attribute in the given config owner attributes list.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Creates a new attribute in the specified config owner attributes list.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes an existing index attribute from the specified attributes list.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns the specified index attribute in the given config owner attributes list. \n\n If zip extension is specified (add ".zip" at the end of the path), the attribute is exported as a zip file.

Method.description: Retrieve configuration of a resource in zip format.

Method.description: Updates a collection of search interfaces in the existing search interface folder.

Method.description: Creates the search interface folder for the specified application.

Method.description: Deletes the search interface folder for the specified application. \n\n CAUTION: Deleting all search interfaces from your Guided Search application will render your application incapable of performing searches. Deleting your application's list of search interfaces also deletes all individual search interfaces.

Method.description: Returns the search interface folder for the specified application. Returns metadata about the folder (e.g. who created it and when) along with a list of child search interface configurations contained within that folder. \n\n If zip extension is specified (add ".zip" at the end of the path), the search interface folder is exported as a zip file.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: View the specified search interface in JSON format. \n\n If zip extension is specified (add ".zip" at the end of the path), the search interface is exported as a zip file.

Method.description: Updates thesaurus in the specified application.

Returns metadata about the thesaurus entry (e.g. who created it and when). \n\n If zip extension is specified (add ".zip" at the end of the path), the thesaurus configuration is exported as a zip file.

Method.description: Updates keyword redirects configuration of the specified application.

Method.description: Create keyword redirects configuration for the application

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes the keyword redirects configuration from the specified application.

Returns metadata about the keyword redirects (e.g. who created it and when) along with the list of redirect groups. \n\n If zip extension is specified (add ".zip" at the end of the path), the keyword redirects configuration is exported as a zip file.

Method.description: Creates a site for a application

Method.name: DELETE

Method.name: DELETE

Method.name: POST
