Method.name: POST
Method.description: Use this endpoint to request a session token, which you can use with the <tt>/token</tt> endpoint to request a bearer token. The bearer token can be used to authenticate all subsequent API calls to the Oracle Container Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Use this endpoint and a session token to receive a bearer token, which can be used to authenticate all subsequent calls to the Oracle Container Cloud service.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Use this endpoint to cancel an existing bearer token and receive a new bearer token in the response.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns a backup file with that contains all the required configuration information for a specific Oracle Container Cloud Service instance. This file can be used to restore the same configuration for a new Oracle Container Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Use this endpoint to restore an Oracle Container Cloud Service instance from an existing backup file, which was created with either the /v2/export REST API endpoint or the Backup/Restore command on the Oracle Container Cloud Service console Settings menu.

Use the curl form command-line argument to identify the backup file. For more information, see the Examples tab for this endpoint.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: To add a new service to the Service Discovery database, you provide the service details, which are passed to the service using properties in the endpoint root schema and nested schemas.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
Removes an item from the Service Discovery database.

To identify the item to delete, pass the service_id of the item using the ServiceID property within the body of the request.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Get all services in the Service Discovery database.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: To retrieve a list of all the items in the Service Discovery database that are associated with a specific service, use this endpoint to pass the name of the service, using the service_name parameter.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Kills a running container, identified with the container_id parameter.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Starts a specific stopped container, identified with the container_id paramater. Note this endpoint applies only to stopped containers.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Unpauses a specific container, identified with the container_id paramater.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Restarts a specific container, identified with the container_id paramater. Note that this endpoint affects only stopped or running containers.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Stops a specific running container, identified with the container_id paramater.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Pauses a specific running container, identified with the container_id paramater. Note that this endpoint does not affect dead, stopped or paused containers.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves the logs of a container. You identify the container using the container_id parameter in the API request.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves a list of the containers currently instantiated by a specific Deployment. You identify the deployment using the deployment_id parameter.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Retrieves a list of all containers with details.

Note: This endpoint is deprecated and will no longer be available in the future release.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves details of the specified container (identified with the container_id parameter) on a specified host (identified with host_id).

Method.name: POST
Method.description: To create a new deployment, you provide Docker YAML code that defines the elements of the deployment. You include the YAML code in the content parameter in the body of the request.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves a list of the current deployments.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Updates a specific deployment. You identify the deployment using the deployment_id parameter. You define the updated deployment properties using YAML code, which you include in the content parameter in the body of the request.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves details about a specific Deployment. You identify the deployment with the deployment_id parameter.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes a stopped Deployment. You identify the deployment with the deployment_id parameter.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Starts a specific deployment. You identify the deployment using the deployment_id parameter. Note this endpoing applies only to stopped deployments.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Stops a specific, running deployment. You identify the deployment using the deployment_id parameter.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Use this endpoint to verify the current configuration of the deployment webhook. For example, you can verify whether or not the webhook is enabled and verify the value of the full_url_path property.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Use this endpoint to update the configuration of a webhook assigned to the specified deployment. You can enable or disable the webhook or change the value of the <tt>full_url_path</tt> property.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Use this endpoint to manually invoke a webhook that will check for a newer version of the deployment image and retart the deployment.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Use this endpoint to verify the current configuration of the deployment webhook. For example, you can verify whether or not the webhook is enabled and verify the value of the full_url_path property.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves a list of the containers currently instantiated by a specific Deployment. You identify the deployment using the deployment_id parameter.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves a list of all recent events in the system. This is not retained indefinitely and will only contain the last 250 events.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Use this endpoint to retrieve details about all the hosts in your Oracle Container Cloud Service environment. You can use this endpoint to verify the host_id of each host, as well as other properties.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves details of a host. You identify the host using the host_id parameter.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Use this endpoint to move a host to a new resource pool. You identify the host using the host_id parameter in the request. You identify the new resource pool, using the pool_id parameter in the body of the request.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Retrieves a detailed list of the Docker containers deployed on a specific host. You identify the host with the host_id parameter

.

Note: This endpoint is deprecated and will no longer be available in the future release.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Retrieves a list of all hosts in a specific resource pool. You identity the resource pool using the pool_id parameter.

Note: This endpoint is deprecated and will no longer be available in the future release.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves details of the specified container (identified with the container_id parameter) on a specified host (identified with host_id).

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Retrieves a list of all images

.

Note: This endpoint is deprecated and will no longer be available in the future release.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Use this endpoint to get the details about an image. Use the image_id parameter to identify the image and the host_id parameter to identify the host.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Use this endpoint to get a list of the Docker containers that you launched directly from a specific Docker image. For more information, see "Starting a Docker Container Directly from a Docker Image" in Using Oracle Container Cloud Service.

Note: This endpoint is deprecated and will no longer be available in the future release.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Use this endpoint to tag an image on a specific host.

Images can have multiple tags all linked to the same image. Tags are used for readability, as well as to specify which registry they are stored on. Images with a simple tag such as oraclelinux:latest imply that the image is stored on io.docker.com. By tagging an image with a hostname, the registry is specified. For example, docker.oraclecorp.com/oraclelinux:latest would use a registry host of docker.oraclecorp.com.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes a specific image on a host. You identify the image by its registry repository name and optionally by its container tag. Note that the optional container tag must be preceded by a colon (:); for example, <tt>oraclelinux:6.6</tt>.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Use this endpoint to pull an image from a Docker registry to a specific host. You identify the image by its registry repository name and optionally by its container tag. Note that the optional container tag must be preceded by a colon (:); for example, <tt>oraclelinux:6.6</tt>.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Use this endpoint to push an image from specific host to a Docker registry. Note that the optional container tag must be preceded by a colon (:); for example, <tt>oraclelinux:6.6</tt>

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Use this endpoint to run a container from a specific image on a specific host. You identify the image by its registry repository name and optionally by its container tag. Note that the optional container tag must be preceded by a colon (:); for example, <tt>oraclelinux:6.6</tt>

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Updates the value assigned to the specified key. You identify the key using the key parameter. You specify the new value by passing the value in the body of the request.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves the value assigned to the specified key. You identify the key using the key parameter.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes the value assigned to the specific key. You identify the key using the key parameter.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: When you create a new resource pool, you provide the properties of the new resource pool in the body of the request.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Retrieves a list of all resource pool configurations, including the number of hosts in the resource pool and memory usage of the resource pool.

Note: This endpoint is deprecated and will no longer be available in the future release.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: When you update a new resource pool, you provide the updated properties in the body of the request.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves the details of a specific resource pool. You specify the pool using the poolID parameter.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes a specific resource pool. You identify the resource pool using the pool_id parameter.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves a list with details about all the resource pools in the Container service database.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Retrieves a list of all hosts in a specific resource pool. You identity the resource pool using the pool_id parameter.

Note: This endpoint is deprecated and will no longer be available in the future release.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: To create a new registry entry, you pass the properties of the new registry entry using the body of the request.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Retrieves details about all the registries available in your Oracle Container Cloud Service environment.

You can use this endpoint to get the registry_id for a specific registry. The registry_id is required if you want to perform operations on a specific registry.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Updates a specific registry. You identify the registry using the registry_id parameter.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves details of a specific registry. You identify the registry using the registry_id parameter.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes a specific registry entry. You identify the registry using the registry_id parameter.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Searches for any occurrence of a string in all values in the API. You enter the case-insensitive search string in the body of the request.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: To create a new service, you pass the properties of the new service in the body of the request.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves a list of all services in the Oracle Container Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Updates the properties of a specific service. You identify the service using the service_id path parameter. You provide the updated properties in the body of the request.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves details about a specific service. You identify the service using the service_id path parameter.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes a specific service. You identify the service using the service_id parameter.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
To create a new deployment, based on a specific service, you specify the source service (the server upon which you are basing the new service) using the service_id parameter in the request. All additional details about the new deployment are passed via the properties within the body of the request.

Note: This endpoint is deprecated and will no longer be available in the future release.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Creates a new application stack. The new stack will comprise all of the necessary configuration for running a set of services in a coordinated way, managed as a single entity, plus default deployment options.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Returns a list of all stacks defined in the Container service database. This includes the pre-packaged stacks and any stacks created since the service instance was created.

For each stack, the list includes the properties of the stack, including the service_id of the stack and details about the services deployed to the stack.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Updates an existing stack. Use this operation to add an additional service to the stack or to modify the properties of an existing service in an existing stack.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns all the details of the specified stack, including the properties and services deployed as part of the stack. The <tt>service_id</tt> is the unique identifier for the stack, as defined when the stack was created. If the display name of the stack was changed, then the <tt>service_id</tt> remains the same.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns a list of all the status updates generated by Container Cloud Service events. Only the last 250 status are retained by the system.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve an array of all tags defined in your Oracle Container Cloud Service environment.

Note: This endpoint is deprecated and will no longer be available in the future release.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Returns a list of all the tags defined in the Container service database.

Note: This endpoint is deprecated and will no longer be available in the future release.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Applies an existing tag to the specified pool or host.

To identify the host or resource pool, use the ID and kind parameters within the body of the request. Use the Tags parameter to identify the tags you want to apply to the host or resource pool.

Note: This endpoint is deprecated and will no longer be available in the future release.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Before you an apply a tag, you must create it using this operation.

Note: This endpoint is deprecated and will no longer be available in the future release.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns a list of the last 250 tasks created by the Container Cloud Service.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Returns a list of details about a specific task. You can get the task_id of a task using the /api/v2/tasks/ endpoint.

Details include the status of the task, if and when the task was canceled, when the task was created, and the name of the task.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Performs an action against a specific task that was scheduled by the Container Cloud Service. In this release you can perform the "cancel" action on a task.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Retrieves details all the users defined for the specified Oracle Cloud Container Service instance. For this release, only one user is defined for each instance.

Note: This endpoint is deprecated and will no longer be available in the future release.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
Updates the admin user information displayed in the My Profile section of the service console, under Settings.

You pass the updated information using the properties in the request body. Only the First Name, Last Name, and Password properties are saved.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Returns capabilities of server.

Note that authorization is not necessary for this endpoint.

Note: This endpoint is deprecated and will no longer be available in the future release.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Returns the version of the server.

Note that authorization is not necessary for this endpoint.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Lists the names of data sets in the schema. You can list all the data sets that belong to a user or use a query filter to list data sets that match a name pattern.

Use an asterisk (*) as a wildcard in your query filter.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
Creates a data set.

Note: The body parameter is multipart/mixed with two parts. The first part contains load information in the JSON structure shown below. The second part is the data in application/octet-stream format, which is not shown due to a Swagger limitation. Data in the stream can be any custom delimiter separated text data (for example, a CSV file) or in the form of Java object arrays (one per record) which support a wider range of data types.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Creates a new data set or updates an existing data set.

Note: The body parameter is multipart/mixed with two parts. The first part contains load information in the JSON structure shown below. The second part is the data in application/octet-stream format, which is not shown due to a Swagger limitation. Data in the stream can be any custom delimiter separated text data (for example, a CSV file) or in the form of Java object arrays (one per record) which support a wider range of data types.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes a named data set.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about a named data set.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns version and usage information for the REST API.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Creates a new rule to for the Database Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about all Oracle Compute Cloud Service security rules defined for a Database Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Enable or disable any rule, or delete a user-created rule.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Starts an on-demand backup operation on a Database Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns a list of all available backup operations for a Database Cloud Service instance, including both scheduled and on-demand backups.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Starts a recovery operation on a Database Cloud Service Instance using the latest backup or to a point in time specified by backup tag, timestamp, or SCN (System Change Number).

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns an array detailing the patch application operations on a Database Cloud Service instance. Additionally, if an applied patch was rolled back, information about the rollback operation is included in the array element for that patch application operation.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about the long-running job to apply or roll back a patch.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Applies a patch to a Database Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns an array detailing the patch precheck operations performed on a Database Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
Performs a precheck to identity potential issues that might prevent the specified patch from being successfully applied to the service instance; it does not actually apply the patch. Specifically, the patching precheck reports on the following conditions:
  • Disk space shortage
  • Database connectivity failure
  • Compute-node access failure
  • Storage access failure
  • Conflicts with other applied patches

Prechecks do not check whether another administration task that would prevent patching is in progress; for example: backup, recovery, or scaling.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about the long-running job to precheck application of a patch.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns an array detailing the patches available to apply to a Database Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Rolls back a patch that was applied to a Database Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Returns detailed information about SSH keys for one or more Database Cloud Service instances as determined by query parameters you provide.

By default, a single request returns a maximum of 50 keys. Use the limitRowCount query parameter to control maximum number returned, and use the offset query parameter to fetch additional results, if available.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Returns summary information about SSH keys for one or more Database Cloud Service instances as determined by query parameters you provide.

By default, a single request returns a maximum of 50 keys. Use the limitRowCount query parameter to control maximum number returned, and use the offset query parameter to fetch additional results, if available.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns detailed information about the SSH key for a Database Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Adds an SSH public key to a Database Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns summary information about the SSH key for a Database Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about the job to add an SSH Key.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Creates a Database Cloud Service instance.

Using this endpoint you can create a Database Cloud Service instance hosting one of the following types of database:

  • A single-instance database running Oracle Database Release 12.2, 12.1 or 11.2

  • A two-node clustered database using Oracle Real Application Clusters (RAC) running Oracle Database Release 12.1 or 11.2

  • An Oracle Data Guard configuration comprising a primary database and a standby database, both running Oracle Database Release 12.2, 12.1 or 11.2

Additionally, if you create a single-instance database, you can create it as a "snapshot clone" of another service instance or have its database loaded from the cloud backup of another database (often called "instantiate from backup").

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about all Database Cloud Service instances. You can view the full set of details by specifying the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
Scales a service instance up or down. Specifically, you can:

  • Scale the shape of the service instance's compute nodes up or down.

  • Add to the service instance's data or backup storage or add a new storage volume to the compute node of a service instance hosting a single-instance database.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Stops, starts or restarts a service instance or one of its compute nodes.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes a Database Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about a Database Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about the compute nodes in a Database Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Change the roles of the primary and standby databases on the two nodes of a Database Cloud Service instance hosting an Oracle Data Guard configuration. You can make three role changes:

  • Switchover: Switches the roles of the primary database and the standby database. There is no data loss during a switchover. After a switchover, each database continues to participate in the Oracle Data Guard configuration in its new role.

  • Failover: Causes the standby database to take over as the primary database. The primary database is no longer considered a part of the Data Guard configuration.

  • Reinstate: Used after a failover to reinstate the previous primary database as part of the Data Guard configuration, giving it the standby role.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
Replace the database in an existing Database Cloud Service instance hosting a single-instance database using a backup of another database. The backup must be have been created by Oracle Database Backup Cloud Service and stored in an Oracle Storage Cloud Service container. Additionally, the database contained by the cloud backup must meet certain requirements:

  • It must be at version 11.2.0.4.0 or version 12.1.0.2.0 with the latest PSU (patch set update) applied.

  • If it is an Oracle 12c database, it must be multitenant (CDB). Database Cloud Service does not support non-CDB Oracle 12c databases.

  • It must use File System or ASM as its storage method for data files.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns the status of a Database Cloud Service instance operation.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Creates a snapshot of the storage volumes of a Database Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns infomation about all the storage snapshots of a Database Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description:
Deletes a storage snapshot of a Database Cloud Service instance.

Note: A snapshot cannot be deleted if there are any service instances cloned from it.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about a storage snapshot of a Database Cloud Service instance.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Creates an Exadata Cloud Service database deployment.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about all Oracle Database Cloud Service databases in an identity domain, including details about both Database Enterprise Service and Exadata Cloud Service database deployments.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Stops, starts or restarts a compute node associated with an Exadata Cloud Service database deployment. These operations impact all databases running on the compute node.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes an Exadata Cloud Service database deployment.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about an Exadata Cloud Service database deployment.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Specify IORM shares for Exadata Cloud Service database deployments.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns the current IORM share allocations.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about the compute nodes associated with an Exadata Cloud Service database deployment.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
Replace the database in an existing Exadata Cloud Service database deployment using a backup of another database. The backup must be have been created by Oracle Database Backup Cloud Service and stored in an Oracle Storage Cloud Service container. Additionally, the database contained by the cloud backup must meet certain suitability requirements:

  • It must be at version 12.2.0.1, 12.1.0.2 or 11.2.0.4.0 with the latest PSU (patch set update) applied.

  • If it is an Oracle 12c database, it must be a multitenant container database (CDB). Exadata Cloud Service does not support non-CDB Oracle 12c databases.

  • It must use File System or ASM as its storage method for data files.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns the status of an operation on Exadata Cloud Service.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Starts an on-demand backup for an Exadata Cloud Service database deployment.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns a list of all available backups for an Exadata Cloud Service database deployment, including both scheduled and on-demand backups.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Starts a recovery operation on an Exadata Cloud Service database deployment using the latest backup or to a point in time specified by a backup tag, timestamp, or SCN (System Change Number).

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns a list of all applied patches for an Exadata Cloud Service database deployment.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about the specified patching operation for an Exadata Cloud Service database deployment.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Applies a patch to an Exadata Cloud Service database deployment.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns the status of all patching precheck operations that have been executed against the service instance.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
Performs a precheck to identity potential issues that might prevent the specified patch from completing successfully without actually patching the service instance. Specifically, the patching precheck reports on the following conditions:
  • Disk space shortage
  • Database connectivity failure
  • Server access failure
  • Storage access failure

Prechecks do not check whether another administration task (such as backup, restoration, or scaling) is in progress, which would prevent patching.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns the status of a patching precheck operation.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns a list of all available patches for an Exadata Cloud Service database deployment.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Rolls back a patch for an Exadata Cloud Service database deployment.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Returns detailed information about SSH keys for Exadata Cloud Service as determined by query parameters you provide.

By default, a single request returns a maximum of 50 keys. Use the limitRowCount query parameter to control maximum number returned, and use the offset query parameter to fetch additional results, if available.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Returns summary information about SSH keys for Exadata Cloud Service as determined by query parameters you provide.

By default, a single request returns a maximum of 50 keys. Use the limitRowCount query parameter to control maximum number returned, and use the offset query parameter to fetch additional results, if available.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns detailed information about an SSH key. This API returns information relating to only one SSH key associated with the Exadata Cloud Service environment that supports the specified database deployment. Other keys may exist. To view detailed information about all of the keys associated with the Exadata Cloud Service environment see View Details for Selected SSH Keys.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Adds an SSH public key for access to Exadata Cloud Service.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns summary information about an SSH key. This API returns information relating to only one SSH key associated with the Exadata Cloud Service environment that supports the specified database deployment. Other keys may exist. To view summary information about all of the keys associated with the Exadata Cloud Service environment see View Summaries for Selected SSH Keys.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about the job to add an SSH Key.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Creates a snapshot master based on the selected Exadata Cloud Service database deployment.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns infomation about all snapshot masters for an Exadata Cloud Service database deployment.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description:
Deletes a snapshot master associated with an Exadata Cloud Service database deployment.

Note: A snapshot master cannot be deleted if there are any linked clones associated with it.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns information about a snapshot master and linked clones associated with an Exadata Cloud Service database deployment.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Creates a new email address import definition. The Bulk API's emailAddresses import allows you to change the global subscription status of email addresses without having to create a contact. The global subscription status can only be changed to unsubscribed. When an email address is imported this way, any present or future contact in Eloqua with the same email address will be automatically globally unsubscribed. Alternatively, to globally subscribe an email address, the /contacts/imports and /contacts/exports endpoints can be used with a sync action.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves a list of email address import definitions.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Updates an email address import definition. For PUT requests, the parameters below are required for validation, even if they are not changing.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes an email address import definition.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves an email address import definition.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Submits the data for the email address import with the specified id. The Bulk API's emailAddresses import allows you to change the global subscription status of email addresses to unsubscribed without having to create a contact. When an email address is imported this way, any present or future contact in Eloqua with the same email address will be automatically globally unsubscribed.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes an email address import definition's synced data.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of resources that are visible to the API user.

Resource visibility is determined by the users resource tree association. For example, if the user can only see a single bucket, the response will only be for that portion of the resource tree. If the user has access to the entire resource tree, the response returns all the resources.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation creates a new resource.

The resource must be assigned to one or more users in the system.

Method.name: PATCH
Method.description: This operation updates the properties of the specified and existing resource with the specified fields.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns information about the specified resource.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation creates a work plan to the specified group resource for the specified date.

Work plans may be used by a field manager in Oracle Field Service Cloud Mobility application to measure a planned amount of working time for a group for each particular day.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description:
This operation deletes the assigned work plan for a specified group resource for the specified date.

Work plans may be used by a field manager in Oracle Field Service Cloud Mobility to measure a planned amount of working time for a group for each particular day.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns the list of assigned work plans for a specified group resource.

Work plans may be used by a field manager in Oracle Field Service Cloud Mobility to measure a planned amount of working time for a group for each particular day.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This operation assigns a work zone to the specified resource.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns details about the work zone(s) assigned to the specified resource.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes a specific work zone from the specified resource.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation sets work skills for the specified resource. In more detail:
  • It removes all current work skills from the resource, by setting their endDate to the past.
  • Then it sets work skills to what is sent in the request.
  • Then it returns new current work skills, and the past ones.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns details about the work skill(s) assigned to the specified resource.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes work skill(s) for the specified resource.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation creates a location for the specified resource.

Once the location is created, the 'Set assignedlocation' operation must be used to assign the 'start', 'end', or 'home zone center' location.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns the locations assigned to the specified resource.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes the specified location for the specified resource.

Method.name: PATCH
Method.description: This operation updates the details of the specified location object.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns the details of the specified location object.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of activities assigned to a specified resource for a specified date.

Special values can be passed into the date field to instead return list of activities not scheduled for any specific date, or list of multiday activities assigned for this resources. See Examples section for these cases.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This operation activates the specified resources route when the 'date' is the current day; else, this operation fails.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This operation activates the specified resource's route.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This operation will create a new inventory assigned to the specified resource. The inventory will have status = 'resource'.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation retrieves data on the resource pool inventories of the specified resource.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation performs the 'install' action on the specified inventory. This changes the inventory's status to 'installed' and places it into 'installed' list of inventories for the specified activity.

Note: You must specify the activityId if the inventory for which the operation is performed is associated with a multi-day activity.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of children of the specified resource and all their descendants.

These are all the resources that are located below the specified resource on a resource tree in Oracle Field Service Cloud Manage.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation creates a work schedule for the specified resource.

Work schedules are a representation of resources work calendar, which includes, working hours, working and non-working days, reasons for absence, and so on.

Any previous assignments for the dates are overwritten.

For example, if schedule X is currently assigned (startDate=2015-10-06, endDate=indefinite), and then an API call assigns the schedule Y (startDate=2015-11-06, endDate=2015-11-07). The schedules after assignment are:

  • X (startDate=2015-10-06)
  • Y (startDate=2015-11-06)
  • X again (startDate=2015-11-07, endDate=indefinite)

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of work schedules assigned to the specified resource.

Work schedules are a representation of resources work calendar, which includes, working hours, working and non-working days, reasons for absence, and so on.

Note: This operation does not return work schedules configured for parent resources.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description:
This operation deletes a specific work schedule for the specified resource.

Work schedules are a representation of resources work calendar, which includes, working hours, working and non-working days, reasons for absence, and so on.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of work schedules for the specified resource for the specified interval of days.

This operation may be used to render work schedules on a calendar view control, such as a month or week view.

Work schedules are a representation of resources work calendar, which includes, working hours, working and non-working days, reasons for absence, and so on.

Note: Work schedules configured for parent resources are returned only if Field Service Cloud supports them.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns the list of children of the specified resource.

These resources are located one level below the specified resource on a resource tree in Oracle Field Service Cloud Manage.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: This operation creates the specified 'file' property for the specific resource.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes the specified 'file' property for the specific resource.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation gets the specified 'file' property for the specific resource.

It is possible to resume an incomplete download by identifying the offset in the range header. For example, "Range: bytes=1000-" means: download starting from offset 1000 bytes up to the end of file.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation creates or updates or removes location(s) for the specified resource. This includes the 'start', 'end' and 'home zone center' locations.

When the location is specified in the request, the location is assigned to the resource.

When the location is not specified or is empty in the request, the location is removed from the resource for the weekdays specified in the request.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns details about the location(s) assigned to the specified resource. This includes the 'start', 'end', and 'home zone center' locations.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: This operation updates the list of users assigned to the specified resource.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation removes all users assigned to the specified resource.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation deactivates the specified resources route when the following conditions are met:
  • The 'date' must be the current or next day if overnight is used; else, this operation fails.
  • The route must not contain any 'pending' activities.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of resources which can complete this activity based on the criteria in the request. Only resources that match all of the criteria specified in request will be returned in response.

Overnight

Overnight is represented as ["FROM_TIME","TO_TIME"] where, the FROM_TIME is greater than the TO_TIME.

For example, ["12:00","10:00"] indicates that the provider working time is from 12:00 to 10:00 of the next day, that is, 22 hours.

Fitness formula for "workTime"

The length (in minutes) of intersection interval of "activity window" with "technician working schedule".

The parameter "activity window" is an intersection of SLA window and SW window for the parameter "date". If activity window is empty or undefined, then the value is equal to the duration of technicians working day.

Fitness formula for "workZone"

The Resource's workzone ratio for the activity workzone (0-100).
  • The value is 100 if the activity does not have a work zone (no work zone requirements).
  • The value is 0 if this resource does not have the activity's work zone assigned to it.
  • Else, the value is equal to the 'ratio' of the resource's assigned work zone.

Fitness formula for "workSkill"

  • The value is 100 if:
    • the activity does not have any work skill requirements.
    • the resource meets all the work skill requirements for this activity, that is, all resource's skill ratios ≥ activity's preferred ratios.
  • The value is 0 if the resource does not have the work skills required for this activity, that is, all resource's skill ratios are less than activity's required ratios.
  • Else, the following formula is used:

    ∏[skill]( resource[skill].ratio - activity[skill].required ) / ( resource[skill].preferable - resource[skill].required )

    with the following exceptions:

    • if dividend ≤ 0, then it is set to 0
    • if divisor is 0, then it is set to 1

Fitness formula for "resourcePreference"

The level of correspondence to activity resource preferences.

  • The value is 0 if,
    • the resource is in the Denied Resources list, or
    • the required Resources list is not empty and the Resource is not in the list
  • The value is 1 if Preferred Resources list is empty or the Resource is in the list.
  • The value is 0.5 for other cases.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of users that are visible to the user making the call.

The visibility rules based on the users resource association. If the user is assigned to the top level of the resource tree, all resources are visible and returned in the response. If the user is assigned to a lower level in the resource tree, the response only returns resources for that portion of resource tree.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation creates a new user.

When creating a new user:

  • The user login must be unique.
  • The user must be assigned to one or more resources.
  • The user must be assigned a User Type.

If the user timeZone field is not specified, they inherit the time zone assigned to the Parent in the Resource tree.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes the specified user account.

Method.name: PATCH
Method.description: This operation updates properties of the specified user account.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation retrieves details of the specified user account.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This operation creates collaboration groups for the specified user.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes all the assigned collaboration groups for the specified user.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns a list of the collaboration groups associated to the specified user.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: This operation creates the specified 'file' property for the specific user.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes the specified 'file' property for the specific user.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation gets the specified 'file' property for the specific user.

It is possible to resume an incomplete download by identifying the offset in the range header. For example, "Range: bytes=1000-" means: download starting from offset 1000 bytes up to the end of file.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This operation always creates a new activity. The new activity has status set to 'pending'. Creates a pending activity test test test

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns all activities matching the search criteria.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation creates or updates multiple activities at once.

This operation is intended for use when synchronizing data from an external system to Oracle Field Service Cloud. The operation performs the following:

  • attempts to find a matching activity in Oracle Field Service Cloud based on the key fields provided in request.
  • creates a new activity if no match is found or update the existing activity if a match is found.
  • updates related objects of this activity, if they are present in request. Related objects include, customer inventories, required inventories, resource preferences, and activity links.

Updates are executed in the same order as activity items appear in request.

This operation is not executed as single transaction, it is executed as multiple transactions each of which may succeed or fail. The response contains a list of results including the success or failure of each update and why it failed (if applicable).

Restrictions:

The following restrcitions apply while updating multiple activities at once:

  • Maximum number of activities per request is 20
  • Maximum size of the decoded HTTP request is 2 MB
  • File properties cannot be set

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation retrieves activity properties for the specified activity.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description:
This operation deletes the specified activity when the following conditions are met:
  • Activity status is 'pending'
  • Activity date must not be in the past
  • Route must not be started

    Note: If the activity is 'started', the Cancel action should be used.

Method.name: PATCH
Method.description:
This operation updates the properties of the specified activity.

The properties that cannot be updated include date, status, resourceId, activityId, positionInRoute, and custom properties of type 'file'.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation retrieves the list of inventories installed during the specified activity. Such inventories have status='installed'.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns the segments related to the specified multiday activity.

A multiday activity can span across multiple days and be assigned to one or more resources. This is done by dividing the activity into segments; each segment is an activity that can be statused (that is, started, completed, and so on). All activity segments have:

  • "recordType" set to "multiday_activity_segment"
  • "masterActivityId" set to the ID of the parent multiday activity
ScenarioAPI Logic

The client terminates a multi-day activity with the following details:

  • The status of the activity is Started.
  • The activity has a segment with the Started status.
  • The client sends a Cancel request for another segment, specifying the final status for the multi-day activity in the request with the multidayActivityStatus attribute.
The API returns the error: HTTP 409 Conflict. Unable to terminate a multi-day activity that has a started segment.
The client specifies the value of multidayActivityStatus in the request, but does not specify the value of multidayTimeToComplete. The API assumes multidayTimeToComplete to be zero and proceeds with the request.
The client sends multidayActivityStatus and non-zero multidayTimeToComplete in the request. The API returns the error: HTTP 400 Bad Request.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation is used to set the activity status to 'started'.

The operation fails if the specified activity has a status other than 'pending', or if the activity has 'date' in the past

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation sets the activity status to 'completed'.

The operation fails if the specified activity has status other than 'started' or if the activity has 'date' in the past.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation suspends the specified activity. This is available when the activity is in a 'started' or 'pending' status.
  • For started activities, this method changes the activity status to 'pending', making it not-ordered and creates a new 'suspended' activity duplicating the original one. The 'end_time' of the 'suspended' activity is set to the time when the activity was suspended. If specified in the request, activity properties are updated for both activities.
  • For pending activities, this method makes the activity not-ordered but does not create a new activity.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation moves the activity according to specified parameters.
  • If setDate is specified, the activity is moved to the specified date.
  • If setResource parameter is specified, the activity is reassigned to another resource.
  • If setPositionInRoute is specified, the activity order is changed.

It is possible to combine these three parameters into a single request where the actions are performed simultaneously.

The operation will fail in case of the following:

  • Destination resource is a field resource and does not have a working day at the specified date
  • Destination resource is a field resource and does not have user account assigned to it (a user with main resource id set to this resource)
  • Destination resource is inactive
  • Destination date is further in the future than 'Future days limit' configuration setting (default is 1098)
  • Destination date is in the past
  • Destination resource does not exist or cannot be assigned activities
  • The operation is disabled for this activity type
  • Bad request parameters

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This operation starts the prework on the specified activity.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation sets the status of a specified pending activity to 'cancelled'.

The operation fails if the specified activity has status other than 'pending', or if the activity has 'date' in the past.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation reopens a 'completed', 'cancelled', or 'not done' activity.

This action creates a new activity with that status as 'pending'. Properties are duplicated based on the property configuration.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation sets the activity status to 'notDone'.

The operation fails if the specified activity has status other than 'started' or if the activity has 'date' in the past.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation extends the duration of a currently by changing the end time of a 'started' activitiy. It is used to indicate that the activity is taking longer than initially predicted.

The operation fails if the specified activity has status other than 'started'.

Delay options include one of the following:

  • delayUntilTime (optional): Date Time in ISO format. For example, "2016-02-09 15:39:00".
  • Increase expected activity duration by given number of minutes. The type is integer.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: This operation creates the specified 'file' property for the specific activity.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes the specified 'file' property for the specific activity.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation gets the specified 'file' property for the specific activity.

It is possible to resume an incomplete download by identifying the offset in the range header. For example, "Range: bytes=1000-" means that download starting from offset 1000 bytes up to the end of file.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation retrieves the list of the inventories deinstalled during the specified activity. Such inventories have status='deinstalled'.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation creates a new link for the specified activity.

Links can be used to identify the dependency between activities. For example, Activity B must be started at the same time as Activity A; Activity A must be complete before Activity B can start.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description:
This operation removes all the links for the specified activity.

Links can be used to identify the dependency between activities. For example, Activity B must be started at the same time as Activity A; Activity A must be complete before Activity B can start.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of links for the specified activity.

Links can be used to identify the dependency between activities. For example, Activity B must be started at the same time as Activity A; Activity A must be complete before Activity B can start.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation creates or replaces a link between two specified activities.

Links can be used to identify the dependency between activities. For example, Activity B must be started at the same time as Activity A; Activity A must be complete before Activity B can start.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a single link between two specified activities.

Links can be used to identify the dependency between activities. For example, Activity B must be started at the same time as Activity A; Activity A must be complete before Activity B can start.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description:
This operation removes the link between two specified activities.

Links can be used to identify the dependency between activities. For example, Activity B must be started at the same time as Activity A; Activity A must be complete before Activity B can start.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation sets the required inventories for the specified activity.

If the specified activity already contains required inventories, this operation updates them with the information specified in the request.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes any existing required inventories assigned to the specified activity.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns the required inventories of the specified activity.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This operation will create a new inventory assigned to the specified activity. The inventory will have status = 'customer'.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation retrieves data on the inventories in the customer's install and deinstall pools of the specified activity.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation sets the resource preferences for the specified activity.

Resource preferences identify if certain resources are preferred/required or forbidden from being assigned to the activity.

If the specified activity already contains resource preferences, this operation replaces them with the values specified in the request.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes any existing required inventories for the activity.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns the resource preferences for the specified activity.

Resource preferences identify if certain resources are preferred/required or forbidden from being assigned to the activity.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This operation is used to fill customer pool with inventories.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes the specified inventory.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation retrieves data on all service requests assigned to the specified inventory.

Method.name: PATCH
Method.description: This operation changes the specified inventory properties.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation installs the specified inventory to the specified activity.

After the update, the specified inventory is moved from the resources pool to the 'installed' pool.

These inventories have a status = 'installed'.

During the install of an inventory you can also specify the properties to be updated.

Note: InventoryType and model properties cannot be updated.

You must specify the 'activityId' if the inventory for which the operation is performed is associated with a multi-day activity.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation is used to 'undo' the specified inventory that was de-installed.

After the update, the specified inventory is moved from the 'Deinstalled' pool to the customer's pool.

The quantity must be provided for non-serialized inventory.

Note: You must specify the 'activityId' if the inventory for which the operation is performed is associated with a multi-day activity.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation will 'undo' the specified inventory that was installed.

After the update, the specified inventory is moved from the 'install' pool to the resources pool.

The quantity must be provided for non-serialized inventory.

Note: when a non-serialized inventory is installed during teamwork activity from a team member's pool, the undoInstall operation will not return it to that team member, but instead will assign it to the team holder. A team member cannot install an inventory from another team member pool, but they can undo-install and this operation will return inventory to its initial team member's pool.

Note: You must specify the 'activityId' if the inventory for which the operation is performed is associated with a multi-day activity.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation will deinstall the specified inventory. After this the inventory will have status = 'deinstalled'

The quantity to be deinstalled must be provided for non-serialized inventory.

During the deinstall of an inventory, you can also specify the properties to be updated.

Note: InventoryType and model properties cannot be updated.

You must specify the 'activityId' if the inventory for which the operation is performed is associated with a multi-day activity.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: This operation creates the specified 'file' property for the specific inventory.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes the specified 'file' property for the specific inventory.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation gets the specified 'file' property for the specific inventory.

It is possible to resume an incomplete download by identifying the offset in the range header. For example, "Range: bytes=1000-" means: download starting from offset 1000 bytes up to the end of file.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns list of events that occurred after the specified 'page' identifier.

If there are no new events available, the operation returns an empty list. If the operation returns an empty list, it is recommended that the same request be sent a later time (for example, in 1-10 minutes) but no later then 36 hours.

If a 'subscriptionId' is specified, only the events matching that subscription's filter are returned in the response.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation creates a subscription for Oracle Field Service Cloud Events.

Events are generated when there is a change to one of the available events in the system (for example, activtyCreated, activityCompleted, inventoryInstalled, and so on).

One or more event(s) should be specified in the request. A 'subscriptionId' is returned indicating that a subscription has been created. This value should be used in the 'Get events' operation to retrieve data that matches this subscription event.

Subscriptions cannot be deleted and will automatically expire if they are not used in 36 hours. This means the 'subscriptionId' was not used in a 'Get events' request during a 36-hour period.

The maximum number of simultaneous subscriptions per instance is 100. In cases where more than one user has created a subscription, the maximum remains at 100 per instance. Attempting to create more than 100 will result in response with Status = 503 and Detail = "Too many subscriptions registered. Found 100." Also, it is not possible to create duplicate subscriptions by the same user; if attempted - they point to the existing subscription object.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns details from a previously created subscription object.

This operation does not return events, but only returns the subscription details.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of dates where a Daily Extract file is available.

Daily Extract files are not available beyond 90 days.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of files which may be downloaded for a specified date.

Daily Extract files are not available beyond 90 days.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation retrieves a single Daily Extract file. The file is usually a binary file with archived daily table content.

Files may be large (greater than 1 GB) so it is possible to resume an incomplete download by identifying the offset in the range header. For example, "Range: bytes=1000-" means: download starting from offset 1000 bytes up to the end of file.

Daily Extract files are not available beyond 90 days.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This authenticates the calling application, and returns Access token

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a collection of properties.

The operation returns all existing translations related to the property.

The response contains the translations for user's language twice; as part of the translation structure and as entity fields.

  • validationRegExp - field that contains regular expression for value validation. It uses PCRE (for example, "^.{7}$").
  • XSLT transformaiton felds are grouped into an object transformation with two fields : regExpLines (an array of strings) and xslt (text representing the XSLT doc).
  • the regExpLines field: each line is in the format of PCRE match pattern = PCRE replace pattern, for example: "/^.*$/m = $0"

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation creates a property object or updates an existing property object.
  • The parameter 'translations' is required. All the translations are replaced by the structure in the request.
  • The attribute 'name' in the translations structure is required for English and cannot be empty. Translations sent as entity fields are ignored.

Note: Properties with type 'field' and property 'country_code' cannot be created; only the 'translations' field can be created or updated.

Method.name: PATCH
Method.description:
This operation updates an existing property.

Only values that are sent with the request should be updated. The values or translations that are not present in the response are not changed by this method.

Note: Properties with type 'field' and property 'country_code' cannot be created; only the 'translations' field can be created or updated.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns the specified property.

The method returns all translations related to the property.

The response contains the translations for user's language twice; as part of the translation structure and as entity fields.

For enumeration property types a link to the 'enumerationList' collection is provided.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation creates an enumeration property or updates the list of enumerations.

The operation is valid only for enumeration property type.

Please note that the:

  • The property must exist.
  • The enumeration items can not be deleted.
  • The property 'country_code' cannot be updated using this operation though the property is of type enumeration.
  • The field 'label' cannot be set to -1 and 0.
  • The English translation for each enumeration item is required and can not be cleared.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns the list of enumerations.

The operation is valid only for enumeration property type.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation updates all the work skill conditions.

The request must contain all the required conditions; conditions that are not provided in the request are removed from the system.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns a list of all work skill conditions.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation creates a new work zone.

The following criterion applies while creating a work zone:

  • Fields must not have any blank space at the end; white spaces are ignored. For example "a ".
  • Values in the keys arrays must be unique.
  • The same key may only be present once in across all active work zones (inactive work zones are ignored).
  • Values in the shapes arrays must be unique.
  • The same shape may only be present once in across all active work zones (inactive work zones are ignored).
  • Validation is case insensitive, that is "a" is the same as "A".

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns a list of work zones that are visible to the API user.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation loads work zone shapefile(s).

Ensure that you upload all the shape data at a time. Every time you upload data, the existing information is removed. Hence, incremental data upload is not supported.

For more information on configuring shapefiles, see the topic Configuring a Custom Map Layer by Using the Metadata API under Use Cases in the Get Started section.

Note:Starting version 16.8.3, when you upload workzone shape files, Oracle Field Service Cloud performs several validations to rectify the data imported from non-Oracle applications. If you already uploaded data, it is recommended that you upload the data again to ensure that there are no issues in your existing data.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: The operations returns the status of a Shapefile import operation.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation updates the specified work zone with the provided attributes.

If the specified work zone already contains attributes, this operation replaces them with the values specified in the request.

The following criterion applies while creating a work zone:

  • Fields must not have any blank space at the end; white spaces are ignored. For example "a ".
  • Values in the keys arrays must be unique.
  • The same key may only be present once in across all active work zones (inactive work zones are ignored).
  • Values in the shapes arrays must be unique.
  • The same shape may only be present once in across all active work zones (inactive work zones are ignored).
  • Validation is case insensitive, that is "a" is the same as "A".

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: The method performs a deletion of existing work zone.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns the attributes for the specified work zone.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a collection of work skills. The operation returns all the existing translations related to the resources.

The response contains the translations for user's language twice; as part of the translation structure and as entity fields.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation creates a work skill or performs a full update to existing work skills.

If the 'translations' parameter is not available in the update, the translations are not changed, else, all the translations are fully replaced by the structure from the response.

Field 'sharing' can be: no sharing, maximal, minimal, or summary.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes the specified work skill.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns the specified work skill. All translations related to the work skill are inlcuded in the response.

The response contains the translations for user's language twice; as part of the translation structure and as entity fields.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a collection of work skills groups in the system.

Each work skill group is defined as a list of work skills with ratio value.

The response contains the translations for user's language twice; as part of the translation structure and as entity fields.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation creates a work skill group resource or performs a full update when an existing resource exists.

If the 'translation' parameter is not available in the update, then the translations are not changed; else all the translations are replaced by the structure from the response.

Translations sent as entity fields are ignored.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes the specified work skill group.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
The operation returns the specified work skill group.

The response contains the translations for user's language twice; as part of the translation structure and as entity fields.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This operation creates a custom map layer.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns a collection of the existing custom map layers.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
The operation creates the process of loading and converting a shapefile into Oracle Field Service Cloud.

Only 10 internal Custom Map Layers are allowed per Oracle Field Service Cloud instance. This means only 10 different labels are allowed for creation in the request.

A shapefile (zip archive) is limited to 2 GB. Not all the information in the zip archive is imported and therefore the maximum amount of data stored as Internal Custom Map Layers is limited to 1 GB per Oracle Field Service Cloud instance.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns the map layer import status.

The possible error messages include:

  • Unexpected script error = Process was terminated unexpectedly.
  • Invalid query format '{query_record} = Missing query ID or instance name.
  • Empty URL= Attempt has empty 'url' field.
  • Failed to download file {url} = Process was unable to download shape file with credentials.
  • Failed to unpack file {url} = Shapefile was successfully downloaded, but unpacking stage (with unzip) failed.
  • File size exceeds limit {filesize_limit} = Shapefile was successfully downloaded and unpacked, but it's size exceeds threshold of 2 GB.
  • Failed to parse shapefile {file_name} = Failed to import downloaded shape file.
  • Failed to process shapefile= Shapefile was parsed, but cannot be striped, theme name cannot be generated (length exceeds limit of 32 characters) or registered as theme for MapViewer.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: This operation updates the attributes of a custom map layer.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes the specified custom map layer.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns a custom map layer with the specified identifier.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a collection of languages.

The response contains the translations for user's language twice; as part of the translation structure and as entity fields.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation may be used to query if a given activity can be booked.\nIt returns the available booking options, such as buckets and time slots where and when activity can be booked.

Overview

This API returns the time slots when the activity can be performed. It is expected that within these time slots:

  • There is enough booking quota for this category for the day.
  • The booking is not closed for this category, time frame, and work zone.
  • There is available workforce to perform this order.

Activity fields

Depending on parameters, this API will calculate the estimated travel time, duration, area, capacity category of the Activity to be booked. In order to do this, activity fields and custom properties have to specified as additional request parameters. Built-in fields have the same names, and are in the same format as in the other REST API operations. The following built-in fields are accepted by this operation:

  • apptNumber
  • recordType
  • customerName
  • customerNumber
  • customerPhone
  • customerEmail
  • customerCell
  • streetAddress
  • city
  • postalCode
  • stateProvince
  • reminderTime
  • longitude
  • latitude
  • slaWindowStart
  • slaWindowEnd
  • points
  • timeOfBooking
  • language
  • timeZone
Custom properties are identified by their label, same as in the other REST API operations.

Activity field requirements:

  • Fields that are part of 'work zone key' have to be passed if 'determineAreaByWorkZone' parameter is not set to 'false' or if bucket settings allow to close booking by work zone
  • All fields mentioned in work skill conditions should be passed if 'determineCategory' parameter is 'true', otherwise the category will not be determined
  • Fields that are part of'duration key' need to be passed if 'estimateDuration' parameter is true)
  • Fields that are part of 'travel key' need to be passed if estimateTravelTime parameter is true

Example: if postal code/Zip code is configured as part of travel key, then you should specify ?postalCode=12345 as one of the query parameters to the API call.

Note: If any custom property label conflicts with another parameter of this API - it will be ignored and cannot be used until renamed.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of resources that are visible to the API user.

Resource visibility is determined by the users resource tree association. For example, if the user can only see a single bucket, the response will only be for that portion of the resource tree. If the user has access to the entire resource tree, the response returns all the resources.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation creates a new resource.

The resource must be assigned to one or more users in the system.

If the operation is used after the initial resource is created it acts a replace operation. The existing resource properties are erased and replaced with the properties in the request.

Method.name: PATCH
Method.description: This operation updates the properties of the specified and existing resource with the specified fields.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns information about the specified resource.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation creates a work plan to the specified group resource for the specified date.

Work plans may be used by a field manager in Oracle Field Service Cloud Mobility application to measure a planned amount of working time for a group for each particular day.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description:
This operation deletes the assigned work plan for a specified group resource for the specified date.

Work plans may be used by a field manager in Oracle Field Service Cloud Mobility to measure a planned amount of working time for a group for each particular day.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns the list of assigned work plans for a specified group resource.

Work plans may be used by a field manager in Oracle Field Service Cloud Mobility to measure a planned amount of working time for a group for each particular day.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This operation assigns a work zone to the specified resource.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns details about the work zone(s) assigned to the specified resource.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes a specific work zone from the specified resource.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation sets work skills for the specified resource. In more detail:
  • It removes all current work skills from the resource, by setting their endDate to the past.
  • Then it sets work skills to what is sent in the request.
  • Then it returns new current work skills, and the past ones.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns details about the work skill(s) assigned to the specified resource.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes work skill(s) for the specified resource.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation creates a location for the specified resource.

Once the location is created, the 'Set assignedlocation' operation must be used to assign the 'start', 'end', or 'home zone center' location.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns the locations created at the level of the specified resource.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes the specified location for the specified resource.

Method.name: PATCH
