Method.description: This operation updates the details of the specified location object.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns the details of the specified location object.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of activities assigned to a specified resource for a specified date.

Special values can be passed into the date field to instead return list of activities not scheduled for any specific date, or list of multiday activities assigned for this resources. See Examples section for these cases.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This operation activates the specified resources route when the 'date' is the current day; else, this operation fails.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This operation activates the specified resource's route.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This operation will create a new inventory assigned to the specified resource. The inventory will have status = 'resource'.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation retrieves data on the resource pool inventories of the specified resource.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation performs the 'install' action on the specified inventory. This changes the inventory's status to 'installed' and places it into 'installed' list of inventories for the specified activity.

Note: You must specify the activityId if the inventory for which the operation is performed is associated with a multi-day activity.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of children of the specified resource and all their descendants.

Descendant resources are all the resources that are located below the specified resource on a resource tree in Oracle Field Service Cloud Manage.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation creates a work schedule for the specified resource.

Work schedules are a representation of resources work calendar, which includes, working hours, working and non-working days, reasons for absence, and so on.

Any previous assignments for the dates are overwritten.

For example, if schedule X is currently assigned (startDate=2015-10-06, endDate=indefinite), and then an API call assigns the schedule Y (startDate=2015-11-06, endDate=2015-11-07). The schedules after assignment are:

  • X (startDate=2015-10-06)
  • Y (startDate=2015-11-06)
  • X again (startDate=2015-11-07, endDate=indefinite)

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of work schedules assigned to the specified resource.

Work schedules are a representation of resources work calendar, which includes, working hours, working and non-working days, reasons for absence, and so on.

Note: This operation does not return work schedules configured for parent resources.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description:
This operation deletes a specific work schedule for the specified resource.

Work schedules are a representation of resources work calendar, which includes, working hours, working and non-working days, reasons for absence, and so on.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of work schedules for the specified resource for the specified interval of days.

This operation may be used to render work schedules on a calendar view control, such as a month or week view.

Work schedules are a representation of resources work calendar, which includes, working hours, working and non-working days, reasons for absence, and so on.

Note: Work schedules configured for parent resources are returned only if Field Service Cloud supports them.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns the list of children of the specified resource.

Child resources are the resources that are located one level below the specified resource on a resource tree in Oracle Field Service Cloud Manage.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: This operation creates the specified 'file' property for the specific resource.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes the specified 'file' property for the specific resource.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation gets the specified 'file' property for the specific resource.

It is possible to resume an incomplete download by identifying the offset in the range header. For example, "Range: bytes=1000-" means: download starting from offset 1000 bytes up to the end of file.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation creates or updates or removes location(s) for the specified resource. This includes the 'start', 'end' and 'home zone center' locations.

When the location is specified in the request, the location is assigned to the resource.

When the location is not specified or is empty in the request, the location is removed from the resource for the weekdays specified in the request.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns details about the location(s) assigned to the specified resource. This includes the 'start', 'end', and 'home zone center' locations.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: This operation updates the list of users assigned to the specified resource.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation removes all users assigned to the specified resource.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation deactivates the specified resources route when the following conditions are met:
  • The 'date' must be the current or next day if overnight is used; else, this operation fails.
  • The route must not contain any 'pending' activities.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of resources which can complete this activity based on the criteria in the request. Only resources that match all of the criteria specified in request will be returned in response.

Overnight

Overnight is represented as ["FROM_TIME","TO_TIME"] where, the FROM_TIME is greater than the TO_TIME.

For example, ["12:00","10:00"] indicates that the provider working time is from 12:00 to 10:00 of the next day, that is, 22 hours.

Fitness formula for "workTime"

The length (in minutes) of intersection interval of "activity window" with "technician working schedule".

The parameter "activity window" is an intersection of SLA window and SW window for the parameter "date". If activity window is empty or undefined, then the value is equal to the duration of technicians working day.

Fitness formula for "workZone"

The Resource's workzone ratio for the activity workzone (0-100).
  • The value is 100 if the activity does not have a work zone (no work zone requirements).
  • The value is 0 if this resource does not have the activity's work zone assigned to it.
  • Else, the value is equal to the 'ratio' of the resource's assigned work zone.

Fitness formula for "workSkill"

  • The value is 100 if:
    • the activity does not have any work skill requirements.
    • the resource meets all the work skill requirements for this activity, that is, all resource's skill ratios ≥ activity's preferred ratios.
  • The value is 0 if the resource does not have the work skills required for this activity, that is, all resource's skill ratios are less than activity's required ratios.
  • Else, the following formula is used:

    ∏[skill]( resource[skill].ratio - activity[skill].required ) / ( resource[skill].preferable - resource[skill].required )

    with the following exceptions:

    • if dividend ≤ 0, then it is set to 0
    • if divisor is 0, then it is set to 1

Fitness formula for "resourcePreference"

The level of correspondence to activity resource preferences.

  • The value is 0 if,
    • the resource is in the Denied Resources list, or
    • the required Resources list is not empty and the Resource is not in the list
  • The value is 1 if Preferred Resources list is empty or the Resource is in the list.
  • The value is 0.5 for other cases.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of users that are visible to the user making the call.

The visibility rules based on the users resource association. If the user is assigned to the top level of the resource tree, all resources are visible and returned in the response. If the user is assigned to a lower level in the resource tree, the response only returns resources for that portion of resource tree.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation creates a new user record or replaces an existing one. If a user with the specified login does not yet exist - it will be created. If such user already exists, the existing user's properties are erased and replaced with the properties in the request.

When creating a new user:

  • The user login has to be unique.
  • The user has to be assigned to one or more 'resources'.
  • The other required fields have to be set: 'name', 'userType', 'language', 'timeZone'

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes the specified user account.

Method.name: PATCH
Method.description: This operation updates properties of the specified user account.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation retrieves details of the specified user account.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This operation creates collaboration groups for the specified user.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes all the assigned collaboration groups for the specified user.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns a list of the collaboration groups associated to the specified user.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: This operation creates the specified 'file' property for the specific user.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes the specified 'file' property for the specific user.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation gets the specified 'file' property for the specific user.

It is possible to resume an incomplete download by identifying the offset in the range header. For example, "Range: bytes=1000-" means: download starting from offset 1000 bytes up to the end of file.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation creates a new activity. By default, the new activity has status set to 'pending'.

This operation is a create-only operation. If the operation is used after the initial activity is created with the same request body, a new activity with the same information is created.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns all activities matching the search criteria.

Note: The search operation ends after the number of matching records reaches 1000. If the returned records do not contain the activities that you searched, you must refine the search criteria and perform the operation again.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation creates or updates multiple activities at once.

This operation is intended for use when synchronizing data from an external system to Oracle Field Service Cloud. The operation performs the following:

  • attempts to find a matching activity in Oracle Field Service Cloud based on the key fields provided in request.
  • creates a new activity if no match is found or update the existing activity if a match is found.
  • updates related objects of this activity, if they are present in request. Objects that can be updated are:
    • Customer inventories
    • Required inventories
    • Resource preferences
    • activity links

Updates are executed in the same order as activity items appear in request.

This operation is not executed as single transaction, it is executed as multiple transactions each of which may succeed or fail. The response contains a list of results including the success or failure of each update and why it failed (if applicable).

Restrictions:

The following restrictions apply while updating multiple activities at once:

  • Maximum number of activities per request is 20
  • Maximum size of the decoded HTTP request is 2 MB
  • File properties cannot be set

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation retrieves activity properties for the specified activity.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description:
This operation deletes the specified activity when the following conditions are met:
  • Activity status is 'pending'
  • Activity date must not be in the past
  • Route must not be started

    Note: If the activity is 'started', the Cancel action should be used.

Method.name: PATCH
Method.description:
This operation updates the properties of the specified activity.

The properties that cannot be updated include date, status, resourceId, activityId, positionInRoute, and custom properties of type 'file'.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation retrieves the list of inventories installed during the specified activity. Such inventories have status='installed'.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns the segments related to the specified multiday activity.

A multiday activity can span across multiple days and be assigned to one or more resources. This is done by dividing the activity into segments; each segment is an activity that can be statused (that is, started, completed, and so on). All activity segments have:

  • "recordType" set to "multiday_activity_segment"
  • "masterActivityId" set to the ID of the parent multiday activity
ScenarioAPI Logic

The client terminates a multi-day activity with the following details:

  • The status of the activity is Started.
  • The activity has a segment with the Started status.
  • The client sends a Cancel request for another segment, specifying the final status for the multi-day activity in the request with the multidayActivityStatus attribute.
The API returns the error: HTTP 409 Conflict. Unable to terminate a multi-day activity that has a started segment.
The client specifies the value of multidayActivityStatus in the request, but does not specify the value of multidayTimeToComplete. The API assumes multidayTimeToComplete to be zero and proceeds with the request.
The client sends multidayActivityStatus and non-zero multidayTimeToComplete in the request. The API returns the error: HTTP 400 Bad Request.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation is used to set the activity status to 'started'.

The operation fails if the specified activity has a status other than 'pending', or if the activity has 'date' in the past

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation sets the activity status to 'completed'.

The operation fails if the specified activity has status other than 'started' or if the activity has 'date' in the past.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation suspends the specified activity. This is available when the activity is in a 'started' or 'pending' status.
  • For started activities, this method changes the activity status to 'pending', making it not-ordered and creates a new 'suspended' activity duplicating the original one. The 'end_time' of the 'suspended' activity is set to the time when the activity was suspended. If specified in the request, activity properties are updated for both activities.
  • For pending activities, this method makes the activity not-ordered but does not create a new activity.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation moves the activity according to specified parameters.
  • If setDate is specified, the activity is moved to the specified date.
  • If setResource parameter is specified, the activity is reassigned to another resource.
  • If setPositionInRoute is specified, the activity order is changed.

It is possible to combine these three parameters into a single request where the actions are performed simultaneously.

The operation will fail in case of the following:

  • Destination resource is a field resource and does not have a working day at the specified date
  • Destination resource is a field resource and does not have user account assigned to it (a user with main resource id set to this resource)
  • Destination resource is inactive
  • Destination date is further in the future than 'Future days limit' configuration setting (default is 1098)
  • Destination date is in the past
  • Destination resource does not exist or cannot be assigned activities
  • The operation is disabled for this activity type
  • Bad request parameters

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This operation starts the prework on the specified activity.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation sets the status of a specified pending activity to 'cancelled'.

The operation fails if the specified activity has status other than 'pending', or if the activity has 'date' in the past.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation reopens a 'completed', 'cancelled', or 'not done' activity.

This action creates a new activity with that status as 'pending'. Properties are duplicated based on the property configuration.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation sets the activity status to 'notDone'.

The operation fails if the specified activity has status other than 'started' or if the activity has 'date' in the past.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation extends the duration of a currently by changing the end time of a 'started' activitiy. It is used to indicate that the activity is taking longer than initially predicted.

The operation fails if the specified activity has status other than 'started'.

Delay options include one of the following:

  • delayUntilTime (optional): Date Time in ISO format. For example, "2016-02-09 15:39:00".
  • Increase expected activity duration by given number of minutes. The type is integer.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: This operation creates the specified 'file' property for the specific activity.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes the specified 'file' property for the specific activity.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation gets the specified 'file' property for the specific activity.

It is possible to resume an incomplete download by identifying the offset in the range header. For example, "Range: bytes=1000-" means that download starting from offset 1000 bytes up to the end of file.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation retrieves the list of the inventories deinstalled during the specified activity. Such inventories have status='deinstalled'.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation creates a new link for the specified activity.

Links can be used to identify the dependency between activities. For example, Activity B must be started at the same time as Activity A; Activity A must be complete before Activity B can start.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description:
This operation removes all the links for the specified activity.

Links can be used to identify the dependency between activities. For example, Activity B must be started at the same time as Activity A; Activity A must be complete before Activity B can start.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of links for the specified activity.

Links can be used to identify the dependency between activities. For example, Activity B must be started at the same time as Activity A; Activity A must be complete before Activity B can start.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation creates or replaces a link between two specified activities.

Links can be used to identify the dependency between activities. For example, Activity B must be started at the same time as Activity A; Activity A must be complete before Activity B can start.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a single link between two specified activities.

Links can be used to identify the dependency between activities. For example, Activity B must be started at the same time as Activity A; Activity A must be complete before Activity B can start.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description:
This operation removes the link between two specified activities.

Links can be used to identify the dependency between activities. For example, Activity B must be started at the same time as Activity A; Activity A must be complete before Activity B can start.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation sets the required inventories for the specified activity.

If the specified activity already contains required inventories, this operation updates them with the information specified in the request.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes any existing required inventories assigned to the specified activity.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns the required inventories of the specified activity.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This operation will create a new inventory assigned to the specified activity. The inventory will have status = 'customer'.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation retrieves data on the inventories in the customer's install and deinstall pools of the specified activity.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation sets the resource preferences for the specified activity.

Resource preferences identify if certain resources are preferred/required or forbidden from being assigned to the activity.

If the specified activity already contains resource preferences, this operation replaces them with the values specified in the request.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes any existing required inventories for the activity.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns the resource preferences for the specified activity.

Resource preferences identify if certain resources are preferred/required or forbidden from being assigned to the activity.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation is used to fill customer pool with inventories.

This operation is a create-only operation. If this operation is used after the initial inventory is created with the same request body, a new inventory with the same information is created.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes the specified inventory.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation retrieves data on all service requests assigned to the specified inventory.

Method.name: PATCH
Method.description: This operation changes the specified inventory properties.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation installs the specified inventory to the specified activity.

After the update, the specified inventory is moved from the resources pool to the 'installed' pool.

These inventories have a status = 'installed'.

During the install of an inventory you can also specify the properties to be updated.

Note: InventoryType and model properties cannot be updated.

You must specify the 'activityId' if the inventory for which the operation is performed is associated with a multi-day activity.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation is used to 'undo' the specified inventory that was de-installed.

After the update, the specified inventory is moved from the 'Deinstalled' pool to the customer's pool.

The quantity must be provided for non-serialized inventory.

Note: You must specify the 'activityId' if the inventory for which the operation is performed is associated with a multi-day activity.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation will 'undo' the specified inventory that was installed.

After the update, the specified inventory is moved from the 'install' pool to the resources pool.

The quantity must be provided for non-serialized inventory.

Note: when a non-serialized inventory is installed during teamwork activity from a team member's pool, the undoInstall operation will not return it to that team member, but instead will assign it to the team holder. A team member cannot install an inventory from another team member pool, but they can undo-install and this operation will return inventory to its initial team member's pool.

Note: You must specify the 'activityId' if the inventory for which the operation is performed is associated with a multi-day activity.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation will deinstall the specified inventory. After this the inventory will have status = 'deinstalled'

The quantity to be deinstalled must be provided for non-serialized inventory.

During the deinstall of an inventory, you can also specify the properties to be updated.

Note: InventoryType and model properties cannot be updated.

You must specify the 'activityId' if the inventory for which the operation is performed is associated with a multi-day activity.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: This operation creates the specified 'file' property for the specific inventory.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: This operation deletes the specified 'file' property for the specific inventory.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation gets the specified 'file' property for the specific inventory.

It is possible to resume an incomplete download by identifying the offset in the range header. For example, "Range: bytes=1000-" means: download starting from offset 1000 bytes up to the end of file.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns list of events that occurred after the specified 'page' identifier.

If there are no new events available, the operation returns an empty list. If the operation returns an empty list, it is recommended that the same request be sent a later time (for example, in 1-10 minutes) but no later then 36 hours.

If a 'subscriptionId' is specified, only the events matching that subscription's filter are returned in the response.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation creates a subscription for Oracle Field Service Cloud Events.

Events are generated when there is a change to one of the available events in the system (for example, activtyCreated, activityCompleted, inventoryInstalled, and so on).

One or more event(s) should be specified in the request. A 'subscriptionId' is returned indicating that a subscription has been created. This value should be used in the 'Get events' operation to retrieve data that matches this subscription event.

Subscriptions cannot be deleted and will automatically expire if they are not used in 36 hours. This means the 'subscriptionId' was not used in a 'Get events' request during a 36-hour period.

The maximum number of simultaneous subscriptions per instance is 100. In cases where more than one user has created a subscription, the maximum remains at 100 per instance. Attempting to create more than 100 will result in response with Status = 503 and Detail = "Too many subscriptions registered. Found 100." Also, it is not possible to create duplicate subscriptions by the same user; if attempted - they point to the existing subscription object.

For the list of events that you can subscribe to, see Supported Events.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns details from a previously created subscription object.

This operation does not return events, but only returns the subscription details.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of dates where a Daily Extract file is available.

Daily Extract files are not available beyond 90 days.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a list of files which may be downloaded for a specified date.

Daily Extract files are not available beyond 90 days.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation retrieves a single Daily Extract file. The file is usually a binary file with archived daily table content.

Files may be large (greater than 1 GB) so it is possible to resume an incomplete download by identifying the offset in the range header. For example, "Range: bytes=1000-" means: download starting from offset 1000 bytes up to the end of file.

Daily Extract files are not available beyond 90 days.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This authenticates the calling application, and returns Access token

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a collection of properties.

The operation returns all existing translations related to the property.

The response contains the translations for user's language twice; as part of the translation structure and as entity fields.

  • validationRegExp - field that contains regular expression for value validation. It uses PCRE (for example, "^.{7}$").
  • XSLT transformaiton felds are grouped into an object transformation with two fields : regExpLines (an array of strings) and xslt (text representing the XSLT doc).
  • the regExpLines field: each line is in the format of PCRE match pattern = PCRE replace pattern, for example: "/^.*$/m = $0"

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation creates a property object or updates an existing property object.
  • The parameter 'translations' is required. All the translations are replaced by the structure in the request.
  • The attribute 'name' in the translations structure is required for English and cannot be empty. Translations sent as entity fields are ignored.

Note: Properties with type 'field' and property 'country_code' cannot be created; only the 'translations' field can be created or updated.

Method.name: PATCH
Method.description:
This operation updates an existing property.

Only values that are sent with the request should be updated. The values or translations that are not present in the response are not changed by this method.

Note: Properties with type 'field' and property 'country_code' cannot be created; only the 'translations' field can be created or updated.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns the specified property.

The method returns all translations related to the property.

The response contains the translations for user's language twice; as part of the translation structure and as entity fields.

For enumeration property types a link to the 'enumerationList' collection is provided.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation allows you to change the list of allowed values for an enumeration property.

The operation is valid only for enumeration property type.

Please note that the:

  • The property must exist.
  • The enumeration items can not be deleted.
  • The property 'country_code' cannot be updated using this operation though the property is of type enumeration.
  • The field 'label' cannot be set to "-1" or "0".
  • The English translation for each enumeration item is required and can not be cleared.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns the list of enumerations.

The operation is valid only for enumeration property type.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation updates all the work skill conditions.

The request must contain all the required conditions; conditions that are not provided in the request are removed from the system.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns a list of all work skill conditions.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation allows you to replace the entire work zones collection in a single request. All conflicts are auto-resolved. All existing work zones not present in the request are deactivated.

The operation could be time-consuming. It's recommeded to send no more than 1000 work zones, 10000 keys and shapes in a single request. If the entire work zone collection is larger, then it recommended to replace collection in several requests:

  • A single bulk replace of 1000 zones
  • Followed by bulk update for the next 1000 zones and so on

Per-request limits are:

  • 2000 work zones
  • 20000 keys and shapes
  • 2 MiB total request size

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation creates a new work zone.

The following criterion applies while creating a work zone:

  • Fields must not have any blank space at the end; white spaces are ignored. For example "a ".
  • Values in the keys arrays must be unique.
  • The same key may only be present once in across all active work zones (inactive work zones are ignored).
  • Values in the shapes arrays must be unique.
  • The same shape may only be present once in across all active work zones (inactive work zones are ignored).
  • Validation is case insensitive, that is "a" is the same as "A".

Method.name: PATCH
Method.description:
This operation allows you to update multiple work zones in a single request. All conflicts are auto-resolved.

The operation could be time-consuming. It's recommeded to send no more than 1000 work zones, 10000 keys and shapes in a single request. If the number of work zones to be updated is larger, then it recommended to split the update into several requests.

Per-request limits are:

  • 2000 work zones
  • 20000 keys and shapes
  • 2 MiB total request size

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns a list of work zones that are visible to the API user.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This operation loads work zone shapefile(s).

Ensure that you upload all the shape data at a time. Every time you upload data, the existing information is removed. Hence, incremental data upload is not supported.

For more information on configuring shapefiles, see the topic Configuring a Custom Map Layer by Using the Metadata API under Use Cases in the Get Started section.

Note:Starting version 16.8.3, when you upload workzone shape files, Oracle Field Service Cloud performs several validations to rectify the data imported from non-Oracle applications. If you already uploaded data, it is recommended that you upload the data again to ensure that there are no issues in your existing data.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: The operations returns the status of a Shapefile import operation.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation updates the specified work zone with the provided attributes.

If the specified work zone already contains attributes, this operation replaces them with the values specified in the request.

The following criterion applies while creating a work zone:

  • Fields must not have any blank space at the end; white spaces are ignored. For example "a ".
  • Values in the keys arrays must be unique.
  • The same key may only be present once in across all active work zones (inactive work zones are ignored).
  • Values in the shapes arrays must be unique.
  • The same shape may only be present once in across all active work zones (inactive work zones are ignored).
  • Validation is case insensitive, that is "a" is the same as "A".

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns the attributes for the specified work zone.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a collection of work skills. The operation returns all the existing translations related to the resources.

The response contains the translations for user's language twice; as part of the translation structure and as entity fields.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation creates a work skill or performs a full update to existing work skills.

If the 'translations' parameter is not available in the update, the translations are not changed, else, all the translations are fully replaced by the structure from the response.

Field 'sharing' can be: no sharing, maximal, minimal, or summary.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns the specified work skill. All translations related to the work skill are inlcuded in the response.

The response contains the translations for user's language twice; as part of the translation structure and as entity fields.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a collection of work skills groups in the system.

Each work skill group is defined as a list of work skills with ratio value.

The response contains the translations for user's language twice; as part of the translation structure and as entity fields.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
This operation creates a work skill group resource or performs a full update when an existing resource exists.

If the 'translation' parameter is not available in the update, then the translations are not changed; else all the translations are replaced by the structure from the response.

Translations sent as entity fields are ignored.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
The operation returns the specified work skill group.

The response contains the translations for user's language twice; as part of the translation structure and as entity fields.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This operation creates a custom map layer.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns a collection of the existing custom map layers.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
The operation creates the process of loading and converting a shapefile into Oracle Field Service Cloud.

Only 10 internal Custom Map Layers are allowed per Oracle Field Service Cloud instance. This means only 10 different labels are allowed for creation in the request.

A shapefile (zip archive) is limited to 2 GB. Not all the information in the zip archive is imported and therefore the maximum amount of data stored as Internal Custom Map Layers is limited to 1 GB per Oracle Field Service Cloud instance.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns the map layer import status.

The possible error messages include:

  • Unexpected script error = Process was terminated unexpectedly.
  • Invalid query format '{query_record} = Missing query ID or instance name.
  • Empty URL= Attempt has empty 'url' field.
  • Failed to download file {url} = Process was unable to download shape file with credentials.
  • Failed to unpack file {url} = Shapefile was successfully downloaded, but unpacking stage (with unzip) failed.
  • File size exceeds limit {filesize_limit} = Shapefile was successfully downloaded and unpacked, but it's size exceeds threshold of 2 GB.
  • Failed to parse shapefile {file_name} = Failed to import downloaded shape file.
  • Failed to process shapefile= Shapefile was parsed, but cannot be striped, theme name cannot be generated (length exceeds limit of 32 characters) or registered as theme for MapViewer.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: This operation updates the attributes of a custom map layer.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: This operation returns a custom map layer with the specified identifier.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
This operation returns a collection of languages.

The response contains the translations for user's language twice; as part of the translation structure and as entity fields.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Uploads an attachment (such as a WSDL file) to a connection and associates the attachment with a specific connection property. If you are using cURL, use the -F option to specify the file to import.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves an attachment for a connection property. This operation returns a byte stream that is output to the display by default. If you are using cURL, use the -o option to save the response to a file.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Updates a Connection.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes a connection.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves a connection. Results include the extended metadata for the connection, but do not include the connection in its entirety.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves a list of integrations.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Imports (replaces) an integration with the same name that was exported previously. If you are using cURL, use the -F option to specify the file to import.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Imports (adds) an integration that was exported previously. Importing an integration under a different user name or version that was exported is not supported. If you are using cURL, use the -F option to specify the file to import.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes an integration.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves an integration. Results include the extended metadata for the integration, but do not include the integration in its entirety (refer to the export API).

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Activates an integration.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Deactivates an integration.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Runs an integration flow.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Clones an integration. The request body must contain at least the code, version, and name fields.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Exports an integration. This operation returns a byte stream that is output to the display by default. If you are using cURL, use the -o option to save the response to a file.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Resumes a schedule.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Starts a schedule.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Pauses a schedule.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Stops a schedule.

Method.description: Deletes a package.

Method.name: GET

Method.description: Imports (adds) an integration that was exported previously. Importing an integration under a different user name or version that what was exported is not supported. If you are using cURL, use the -F option to specify the file to import.

Method.description: Updates an integration. Currently status is the only supported field to update.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes a single integration by ID. The ID consists of the code and the version separated by the | (vertical line) character. When using cURL, substitute the %7C code for the vertical line.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves a single integration by ID. The ID consists of the code and the version separated by the | (vertical line) character. When using cURL, substitute the %7C code for the vertical line.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Exports an integration. This operation returns a byte stream that is output to the display by default. If you are using cURL, use the -o option to save the response to a file.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Clones an integration. The request body must contain at least the code, version, and name fields.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Resume schedule of an integration flow.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Stop schedule of an integration flow.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Pause schedule of an integration flow.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Start schedule of an integration flow.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Runs an integration flow.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Fetches the ESS job status.

Method.name: OPTIONS
Method.description: Retrieves the metadata link for a lookup.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves a list of lookups.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description: Imports (replaces) a lookup with the same name that was exported previously. If you are using cURL, use the -F option to specify the file to import.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Imports (adds) a lookup that was exported previously. Importing a lookup under a different user name or version than what was exported is not supported. If you are using cURL, use the -F option to specify the file to import.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes a lookup by name.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves a lookup by ID.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Exports a lookup. This operation returns a byte stream that is output to the display by default. If you are using cURL, use the -o option to save the response to a file.

Method.description: Retrieves the metadata link for a package.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves a list of packages.

Method.description: Imports (adds) a package that was exported previously. If you are using cURL, use the -F option to specify the file to import.

Method.description: Deletes a package.

Method.description: Retrieves a package by name.

Method.description: Retrieves a list of flow instances.

Method.name: OPTIONS

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves a list of error instances.

Method.description: Retrieves an error instance.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Resubmit or discard one or more error instances based on ID, IDs, connection, or integration.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves a monitoring audit records based on query.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Imports (adds) a certificate into a specified keystore. The id in the context of the certificate always refers to a compound key which consists of the keystore (TRUST, OWSM, Identity) and the certificate name separated by | (vertical line). If you are using cURL, use the -F option to specify the file to import.

Method.name: OPTIONS
Method.description: Retrieves the certificates metadata link.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves a list of certificates.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: Imports (replaces) a certificate with the same name that was exported previously. The id in the context of the certificate always refers to a compound key which consists of the keystore (TRUST, OWSM, Identity) and the certificate name separated by | (vertical line). If you are using cURL, use the -F option to specify the file to import.

Method.name: DELETE
Method.description: Deletes a single certificate specified by id. The id in the context of the certificate always refers to a compound key which consists of the keystore (TRUST, OWSM, Identity) and the certificate name separated by | (vertical line). In case of using curl the vertical line should be escaped by %7C.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieves a single certificate specified by id. The id in the context of the certificate always refers to a compound key which consists of the keystore (TRUST, OWSM, Identity) and the certificate name separated by | (vertical line). In case of using curl the vertical line should be escaped by %7C.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Returns a JSON document that describes all available versions of the Oracle IoT Cloud Service REST API. The request returns a different attribute for each version number, and the returned JSON document contains a nested JSON object with a canonical link to additional information about that particular REST API version, along with documentation or other information.
curl -X GET 
   -u <username>:<password> 
   -H 'Accept: application/json' 
   http://iotserver/iot/api/

Example of Response Body

The following example shows the content of the response body in JSON format 


{
    "offset":0,
    "count":2,
    "limit":10,
    "hasMore":false,
    "links":[
        {
            "rel":"self",
            "href":"http://iotserver/iot/api/version/resource/path"
        },
        {
            "rel":"canonical",
            "href":"http://iotserver/iot/api/version/resource/path"
        }
    ],
    "items":[
        {
            "lifecycle":"Life cycle status of the version (active or deprecated)",
            "isLatest":false,
            "links":[
                {
                    "rel":"self",
                    "href":"http://iotserver/iot/api/version/resource/path"
                },
                {
                    "rel":"canonical",
                    "href":"http://iotserver/iot/api/version/resource/path"
                }
            ],
            "version":"Version id"
        },
        {
            "lifecycle":"Life cycle status of the version (active or deprecated)",
            "isLatest":false,
            "links":[
                {
                    "rel":"self",
                    "href":"http://iotserver/iot/api/version/resource/path"
                },
                {
                    "rel":"canonical",
                    "href":"http://iotserver/iot/api/version/resource/path"
                }
            ],
            "version":"Version id"
        }
    ]
}



Complete cURL Example

The following example shows compete cURL comand that can be used to perform described operation

curl -X GET 
   -u <username>:<password> 
   -H 'Accept: application/json' 
   http://iotserver/iot/api/



Note that in the request, http://iotserver will be replaced by the name and port of your assigned IoT Cloud Service instance. The format of the Cloud Service instance is https:// myinstance-myidentitydomain.iot.us.oraclecloud.com and the default port is 443.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This API enables a Gateway to activate device application endpoints assigned to it. If a device application with the specified appName, version and hostEndpointId is already registered, the server will activate that device application and return its Endpoint Id. If it is not registered, the server will register the device application first using the provided information and then activate it, returning its Endpoint Id in the response payload.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This API enables a Gateway to activate devices connected to it that cannot connect to the Oracle IoT Cloud Service instance directly themselves and need assistance from the Gateway. hardwareId must be set in the request payload. If a device with the specified Hardware Id is already registered, the server will activate that device and return its Endpoint Id. If it is not registered, the server will register the device first using the provided information and then activate it, returning its Endpoint Id in the response payload.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: The API allows the device to get the parameters needed to perform activation. This API is needed only for direct activation. The caller sends the device attributes in the request and the server responds with the cryptographic parameters to be used during the activation process.

Method.name: POST
Method.description: This API enables a device to directly activate itself. Note that if a device has both the predefined Device Models urn:oracle:iot:dcd:capability:direct_activation and urn:oracle:iot:dcd:capability:indirect_activation, the device type is recognized as GATEWAY. If a device only has the Device Model urn:oracle:iot:dcd:capability:direct_activation, the device type is recognized as DIRECTLY_CONNECTED_DEVICE. A device must belong to one of the above types to have the direct activation capability.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
This API implements the the OAuth2 client credentials grant flow, which enables clients to obtain an access token by authenticating themselves. The client credentials flow is used when the client itself owns the data and does not need delegated access from a resource owner, or when delegated access has been provided outside of the OAuth2 flow. This flow relies on the client to authenticate with the server, and the client's authentication credentials remain confidential.

This API supports the following authentication mechanisms:

  • client_assertion: used by the client that asserts its identity using a JSON Web Token (JWT). The JWT contains the signature that proves the possession of the private key.

The OAuth2 scope attribute is required for all requests for access tokens. The server supports the following scopes:

  • scope=oracle/iot/activation: used to obtain an access token for calling Activation REST APIs only
  • scope=empty scope, used to obtain an access token for calling all other REST APIs

Any other scope value results in a BAD_REQUEST error.

JSON Web Token (JWT)

An open standard (RFC 7519) that defines a compact and self-contained way for securely transmitting information between parties as a JSON object. This information can be verified and trusted because it is digitally signed. JWTs can be signed using a secret (with HMAC algorithm) or a public/private key pair using RSA.

JSON Web Tokens consist of three parts separated by dots (.), which are:

  • Header
  • Payload
  • Signature

Therefore, a JWT typically looks like the following.

xxxxx.yyyyy.zzzzz

Header

The header for authentication consists of two parts: the type of the token, which is JWT, and the hashing algorithm such as HmacSHA256 ("HS256") or SHA256withRSA ("RS256").

Payload

The second part of the token is the payload, which contains the claims about the Device Endpoint.

Required claims: These are a set of required claims for authentication:

  • iss (issuer, should be the Device Activation ID for Activation purpose and Device Endpoint Id for Messaging purpose)
  • exp (expiration time, the epoch value in seconds. If the expiration time is outside a 30 minute window, the request is rejected)
  • aud (audience, should be "oracle/iot/oauth2/token").

Signature

To create the signature part you have to take the encoded header, the encoded payload, a key, the algorithm specified in the header, and sign that in the following way:

Algorithm(base64UrlEncode(header) + "." +base64UrlEncode(payload), key)

Note HmacSHA256 is only used in the activation procedure (scope=oracle/iot/activation), and the key used for the signature is the shared secret of the Device Endpoint. SHA256withRSA is used in other procedures (scope is empty), such as posting a message, and the secret key of the Device Endpoint is used as the key for signature.

Complete cURL Example

The following example shows compete cURL comand that can be used to perform described operation

curl -X GET 
   -u <username>:<password> 
   -H 'Accept: application/json' 
   http://iotserver/iot/api/v2/apps/728c769360ae-75d4/deviceModels/



Note that in the request, http://iotserver will be replaced by the name and port of your assigned IoT Cloud Service instance. The format of the Cloud Service instance is https:// myinstance-myidentitydomain.iot.us.oraclecloud.com and the default port is 443.

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Retrieve a document with the total number of device models consumed by the application.
curl -X GET 
   -u <username>:<password> 
   -H 'Accept: application/json' 
   http://iotserver/iot/api/v2/apps/{app-id}/deviceModels/count

}

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Retrieve a collection of Devices records. The devices that participate in an application is intersection of following two sets of devices

  • All the devices that implement at least one of the device models consumed by the app
    • All the devices that are members of at least one device group created for the app

If there is no device selection criteria specified for the device selection group/s for the app, then basically all the devices corresponding to all the device models that the app consumes would be returned for the API

curl -X GET 
   -u <username>:<password> 
   -H 'Accept: application/json' 
   http://iotserver/iot/api/v2/apps/{app-id}/devices/

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
Does the specified resource invocation by forwarding the request to the specified endpoint and providing a response sent by it and received back by the server. The handler of the resource optionally receives request's body that may contain data of an artitrary type. Invocation may take a significant time to complete depending on connectivity of an endpoint; the messages that carry request and response data may stay pending on both sides waiting for a chance to be delivered for minutes, hours, or days.

There are two invocation modes supported by this interface: synchronous and asynchronous. With synchronous request the server does not reply until a response gets received from the endpoint or a timeout expires. If the request is done in the asynchronous mode then the server returns immediately providing an assigned request ID that can be used for polling via another API to check if the response from the endpoint is available. The request mode can be specified with query parameters "iot.sync" or "iot.async". By default if none of the parameters is set then the request is asynchronous. These parameters must not be set both. The asynchronous mode is a preferrable way of doing invocation as it does not consume as much server resources as compared with the sycnhronous mode. Optionally, a timeout value in milliseconds may be provided with the "iot.timeout" query parameter.

The PUT method must be supported by the endpoint resource to expect the request is forwarded to the endpoint. If not, the server rejects the request and replies with an error.

curl -X PUT 
   -u <username>:<password> 
   -H 'Accept: application/json' 
   http://iotserver/iot/api/v2/apps/{app-id}/devices/{device-id}/resources/{subResources}

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
Does the specified resource invocation by forwarding the request to the specified endpoint and providing a response sent by it and received back by the server. The handler of the resource optionally receives request's body that may contain data of an artitrary type. Invocation may take a significant time to complete depending on connectivity of an endpoint; the messages that carry request and response data may stay pending on both sides waiting for a chance to be delivered for minutes, hours, or days.

There are two invocation modes supported by this interface: synchronous and asynchronous. With synchronous request the server does not reply until a response gets received from the endpoint or a timeout expires. If the request is done in the asynchronous mode then the server returns immediately providing an assigned request ID that can be used for polling via another API to check if the response from the endpoint is available. The request mode can be specified with query parameters "iot.sync" or "iot.async". By default if none of the parameters is set then the request is asynchronous. These parameters must not be set both. The asynchronous mode is a preferrable way of doing invocation as it does not consume as much server resources as compared with the sycnhronous mode. Optionally, a timeout value in milliseconds may be provided with the "iot.timeout" query parameter.

The PUT method must be supported by the endpoint resource to expect the request is forwarded to the endpoint. If not, the server rejects the request and replies with an error.

curl -X PUT 
   -u <username>:<password> 
   -H 'Accept: application/json' 
   http://iotserver/iot/api/v2/apps/{app-id}/deviceApps/{devapp-id}/resources/{subResources}

Example of Response Body

The following example shows the content of the response body in JSON format 


{
    "requestTime":"2016-07-22T10:44:57.746Z",
    "responseEventTime":"2016-07-22T10:44:57.746Z",
    "responseStatusCode":"HTTP 200: OK",
    "method":"Request method",
    "endpointId":"55fdaf9257a-2ba8",

        }
    ],
    "id":"4ef025cb69f6-447a",
    "complete":false,
    "url":"http://iotserver/iot/api/version/resource/path",
    "status":"RECEIVED"
}

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Does the specified attributes update by the specified values. Attribute names and new values for the attributes are specified in the requst body JSON document. Incoming JSON document format is {"attribute Name 1":<value1>, "attribute Name 2":<value2> ...} such as { "temp":56.23, "minTemp":0.0 }

curl -X POST 
   -u <username>:<password> 
   -H 'Accept: application/json' 
   --header "X-HTTP-Method-Override: PATCH" 
   http://iotserver/iot/api/v2/apps/{app-id}/deviceApps/{devapp-id}/deviceModels/{devicemodel-id}/attributes/

Example of Response Body

The following example shows the content of the response body in JSON format 


{
    "requestTime":"2016-07-22T10:44:57.746Z",
    "responseEventTime":"2016-07-22T10:44:57.746Z",
    "responseStatusCode":"HTTP 200: OK",
    "method":"Request method",
    "endpointId":"48b83857832-33d",
    "responseTime":"Time when the response is received by server",
    "response":"Original response message payload JSON document",
    "links":[
        {
            "rel":"self",
            "href":"http://iotserver/iot/api/version/resource/path"
        },
        {
            "rel":"canonical",
            "href":"http://iotserver/iot/api/version/resource/path"
        }
    ],
    "id":"66302c002bc9-4609",
    "complete":false,
    "url":"http://iotserver/iot/api/version/resource/path",
    "status":"RECEIVED"
}



Complete cURL Example

The following example shows compete cURL comand that can be used to perform described operation

curl -X POST 
   -u <username>:<password> 
   -H 'Accept: application/json' 
   --header "X-HTTP-Method-Override: PATCH" 
   http://iotserver/iot/api/v2/apps/73361903116d-6577/deviceApps/73361903116d-6577/deviceModels/73361903116d-6577/attributes/



Note that in the request, http://iotserver will be replaced by the name and port of your assigned IoT Cloud Service instance. The format of the Cloud Service instance is https:// myinstance-myidentitydomain.iot.us.oraclecloud.com and the default port is 443.

Method.name: PUT
Method.description:
Does the specified attribute update by the specified value. New values for the attribute are specified in the requst body JSON document. Incoming JSON document format is {"value":<value>}

curl -X PUT 
   -u <username>:<password> 
   -H 'Accept: application/json' 
   http://iotserver/iot/api/v2/apps/{app-id}/deviceApps/{devapp-id}/deviceModels/{devicemodel-id}/attributes/{attribute-name}

Method.name: GET
Method.description:
Returns a list of device messages stored by Oracle IoT Cloud Service that match the query criteria. A query criterion can specify a device or a message type or both through query parameters "device" and "type". Messages are returned in descending order of message recorded time (either receivedTime or sentTime depending on type and direction of the message). The parameters "since" and "until" can be used with any query criteria. The "offset" and "limit" parameters are always applied. The "orderBy" parameter controls the sorting method. The "expand" parameter indicates whether the messages should include the message payload.
curl -X GET 
   -u <username>:<password> 
   -H 'Accept: application/json' 
   http://iotserver/iot/api/v2/apps/{app-id}/messages/

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Updated default device selection group
curl -X POST 
   -u <username>:<password> 
   -H 'Accept: application/json' 
   -H 'Content-Type: application/json' 
   --header "X-HTTP-Method-Override: PATCH" 
   http://iotserver/iot/api/v2/apps/{app-id}/deviceSelectionGroups/default

Example of Request Body

The following example shows the content of the request body in JSON format 


{
    "name":"String with group name",
    "description":"String with group description",
    "membership":{
        "filter":"String with query parameter for current group",
        "selectionMode":"ALL"
    }
}

Example of Response Body

The following example shows the content of the response body in JSON format 


{
    "name":"String with group name",
    "description":"String with group description",
    "links":[
        {
            "rel":"self",
            "href":"http://iotserver/iot/api/version/resource/path"
        },
        {
            "rel":"canonical",
            "href":"http://iotserver/iot/api/version/resource/path"
        }
    ],
    "membership":{
        "filter":"String with query parameter for current group",
        "links":[
            {
                "rel":"self",
                "href":"http://iotserver/iot/api/version/resource/path"
            },
            {
                "rel":"canonical",
                "href":"http://iotserver/iot/api/version/resource/path"
            }
        ],
        "selectionMode":"ALL"
    }

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Update the metadata of an IoT application with data provided in request body.
curl -X POST 
   -u <username>:<password> 
   -H 'Accept: application/json' 
   -H 'Content-Type: application/json' 
   --header "X-HTTP-Method-Override: PATCH" 
   http://iotserver/iot/api/v2/apps/{app-id}/metadata/

Example of Request Body

The following example shows the content of the request body in JSON format 


{
    "metadata":{
        "metadata_key1":"metadata_value1",
        "metadata_key2":"metadata_value2",
        "metadata_key3":"metadata_value3"
    },
    "keys":[
        "keys_1",
        "keys_2",
        "keys_3"
    ],
    "operation":"Operation represents type of the update operation to be performed on IoT Application metadata. Operation can be 'update' to add and/or modify metadata keys values or 'delete' to delete number of metadata entries identified by keys. When operation is 'update', request object have to have a field called 'metadata' containing a set of key-value pairs to be applied as metadata update. When operation is 'delete', request object should have a field called 'keys' with an array of metadata keys to be deleted"
}

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Create a new Integration instance.

An integration is an entity that an IoT Application utilizes to connect with an external enterprise application or cloud service (e.g. vertical business applications like BICS or JD Edwards etc.) An integration defines a set of streams to send data to an external application. A stream is essentially composed of a set of formats and optionally configuration & annotations. The type of integration defines the restriction on the number of streams that may be associated with an integration instance as well as specific restrictions on the composition of the streams themselves.
An integration is a composite object consisting of the following:
  • Name
  • Description
  • Type
  • Configurations
  • Authentication type & its configurations
  • Storage enabled flag
  • Streams
A stream within an integration consists of the following:
  • One or more message formats
  • Annotations (optional)
  • Stream-specific configuration (optional)
Note that an integration exists within the scope of an application.

Integration Types

The following integration types are supported:
  • ENTERPRISE
  • BICS
  • JDE
  • MCS
  • SCS
Each integration type may choose to define its own set of restrictions or requirements on the composition for the integration itself. For example, it may define some necessary configuration items or restrict the number of formats allowed within each stream. Please refer to each integration type to learn more about these restrictions.

ENTERPRISE Integration

Description:
An enterprise integration is a generic integration that can be used to POST data to an external application/cloud service. Note that we now optionally support adding custom static HTTP headers as part of the integration configuration.
ENTERPRISE Integrations can be used for bi-directional data/information flow between an IoT Application and the external applications. To establish inbound channel Integration's endpoint id and shared secret are used by an application to authenticate in the IoT Cloud Service and to get authorization to access the IoT REST APIs. Outbound connection is implemented through the Integration's message dispatching mechanism. If a message's sender belongs to an IoT Application and format field in payload refers to a format, registered on one of the DeviceModels that the Application supports, the message will be mapped to the IoT Application. If the Enterprise Integration under the Application is interested in the format of the message, wihch is indicated in the format list of its streams, the message will be dispatched to the URL of the integration.
Requirements: Nothing specific
Restrictions: Stream level configuration is not supported
Note: Optional HTTP headers are set as a part of config (Integration level) with the key httpHeaders.

BICS Integration

Description:
A BICS integration is an integration that can be used to forward message data to Oracle's Business Intelligence Cloud Service.
BICS Integrations can be used to turn message streams into table data transmitted to and consumed by the BI Cloud Service.
Requirements: Each stream must have a stream-level config element of tableName which represents the name of the table to be created/populated on the BICS side.
Restrictions: Each stream can have one and only one message format specified. No two streams within the same integration may specify the same message format. Once a BICS stream is synchronized to the BICS server, you should avoid changes of or to the message format. The table on the BICS server will not be updated to reflect the new message structure and future synchronizations will be blocked.
Note: Optional HTTP headers are not supported for BICS Integrations.

JD Edwards Integration

Description:
A JD Edwards (JDE) integration targets a particular IoT Orchestration that is exposed by a relevant JDE instance.
Requirements:
  1. Integration level configuration should define the following items:
    • URL - The JDE instance URL
    • Orchestration - The name of the IoT orchestrator with which we're integrating
  2. Authentication type should be specified as BASIC
  3. Connection credential configuration should be specified
Restrictions: Each stream should have only one format. However multiple streams per format will be supported
Note:
  1. Some notes on integration level configuration items:
    • messageType>: Defines the message type that is supported by the JDE orchestrator. Supported values are JDE_STANDARD or IOT_STANDARD (defaults to IOT_STANDARD, if not specified).
    • fields>: If the IoT orchestration supports JDE STANDARD message type, then this item is a mandatory requirement. This item is a JSON object that defines a mapping between the fields of the orchestration and their data types.
  2. Some notes on stream level configuration items:
    • If the orchestration targeted specifies JDE STANDARD message type then for each stream's configuration should contain an item named mapping. This item is a JSON object that defines the mapping between the names of the orchestration fields and the equivalent names from the IoT Message format's fields or annotations chosen'
  3. The message type, fields, their data types can be determined from the return payload of JDE's discovery service. Each orchestration within the discovery payload defines the input type as: JDE_STANDARD or GENERIC. The corresponding names for messageType fields is JDE_STANDARD and IOT_STANDARD respectively
  4. If the message type is IOT_STANDARD, then it is assumed that the corresponding IoT Orchestration is capable of accepting IoT's standard message format

Mobile Cloud Service Integration

Description:
A Mobile Cloud Service (MCS) integration targets REST endpoints available on an MCS Mobile Backend.
Requirements:
  1. Integration level configuration should define the following items:
    • URL - The URL to an available REST endpoint within an MCS mobile backend
    • Mobile Backend ID - The ID associated with the targeted MCS mobile backend, specified within httpHeaders key.
  2. Authentication type should be specified as BASIC
  3. Connection credential configuration should be specified
Restrictions: Stream level configuration is not supported
Note: Oracle-Mobile-BACKEND-ID HTTP header should be specified as part of config within httpHeaders.

Oracle Storage Cloud Service Integration

Description:
The OSCS integration is an integration that can be used to forward message data to Oracle Storage Cloud Service (OSCS).
OSCS Integrations can be used to communication with any product based on OSCS.
Requirements: Each stream must have a stream-level config element contains two special fields. One of them has name containerName> and the value is the name of OSCS container. Other field is named objectName> and the value is the name of object inside container. Container's and object's names in various streams need not be unique.
Restrictions: Each stream can have one and only one message format specified. No two streams within the same integration may specify the same message format. Once an OSCS stream is synchronized to the OSCS server, you should avoid changes of or to the message format. The table on the BICS server will not be updated to reflect the new message structure and future synchronizations will be blocked.
Note: Optional HTTP headers are not supported for OSCS Integrations.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Returns a list of device messages stored by Oracle IoT Cloud Service that match the query criteria. A query criterion can specify a device or a message type or both through query parameters "device" and "type". Messages are returned in descending order of message recorded time (either receivedTime or sentTime depending on type and direction of the message). The parameters "since" and "until" can be used with any query criteria. The "offset" and "limit" parameters are always applied. The "orderBy" parameter controls the sorting method. The "expand" parameter indicates whether the messages should include the message payload.

Method.name: GET
Method.description: Retrieve total count of Integrations for the specified Application

Complete cURL Example

The following example shows compete cURL comand that can be used to perform described operation

curl -X PUT 
   -u <username>:<password> 
   -H 'Accept: application/json' 
   -H 'Content-Type: application/json'  
   -d '{"serialNumber":"A string (which should be unique across all devices of this modelNumber/manufacturer) uniquely identifying the specific device.","activationTimeAsString":"2016-07-22T10:44:57.746Z","partnerName":"Partner name","softwareRevision":"A string representing the software revision.","identityCert":"Endpoint Identity Cert","description":"Endpoint description","type":"UNKNOWN","enabled":false,"manufacturer":"A string, generally an Organizationally Unique Identifier (OUI), that describes the manufacturer of the device.","hardwareId":"31681d191a6-71f2","hardwareRevision":"A string representing the hardware revision.","name":"Endpoint name","modelNumber":"A string representing the specific model of the device.","directlyConnectedOwnerId":"4af92a7e761-6642","state":"REGISTERED","sharedSecret":"Endpoint Shared Secret","softwareVersion":"A string representing the software version."}'
   http://iotserver/iot/api/v2/devices/61ec645464b9-1f2b



Note that in the request, http://iotserver will be replaced by the name and port of your assigned IoT Cloud Service instance. The format of the Cloud Service instance is https:// myinstance-myidentitydomain.iot.us.oraclecloud.com and the default port is 443.

Method.name: POST
Method.description:
Update device details with provided partial or complete device definition, by given device ID

   -u <username>:<password> 
   -H 'Accept: application/json' 
   -H 'Content-Type: application/json'

Note that in the request, http://iotserver will be replaced by the name and port of your assigned IoT Cloud Service instance. The format of the Cloud Service instance is https:// myinstance-myidentitydomain.iot.us.oraclecloud.com and the default port is 443.

Note that in the request, http://iotserver will be replaced by the name and port of your assigned IoT Cloud Service instance. The format of the Cloud Service instance is https:// myinstance-myidentitydomain.iot.us.oraclecloud.com and the default port is 443.

curl -X GET

Complete cURL Example
